Nagpur: Kin of victims, who die in attacks by nilgais and monkeys, will get Rs15 lakh as compensation and those injured will get aid up to Rs1.25 lakh. This is for the first time that nilgais and monkeys have been included in the list of wild animals involved in attacks.

The decision was taken by Maharashtra forest minister Sanjay Rathod at a meeting in Mantralaya on Wednesday. The official government note will be issued in a day or two.

“Till now kin of those who died in tiger, leopard, sloth bear, wild dog, wild boar, gaur, crocodile, elephant, fox and wolf attacks only used to get compensation. We have added nilgai and monkey to the list now,” Rathod told TOI.

The minister said of the Rs15 lakh, a cheque of Rs3 lakh will be handed over to the kin immediately. The remaining Rs12 lakh will be kept as fixed deposit and interest towards this amount will be deposited in the savings bank account.

For injuries that need to be treated at private hospitals there will be a cap of Rs20,000 per person. In case of permanent disability, the victim will get Rs5 lakh compensation.

According to sources, the government is also contemplating to provide financial assistance to snake bite victims. All snakes are listed in Schedule I-IV under the Wildlife Protection Act, 1972.

“There have been demand from people’s representatives to give compensation to snake bite victims but owing to many cases, the issue was never taken up seriously. There are several nitty-gritty’s in such cases which will be resolved before taking a final decision,” said sources close to forest minister.

Title: KT Rama Rao: Perform or perish; Telangana IT Minister KT Rama Rao to municipal commissioners
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

KT Rama Rao

HYDERABAD: After warning newly-elected corporators and councillors that they may lose their job if they fail to deliver, now it is the turn of municipal commissioners. Municipal administration minister KT Rama Rao has said the state government will not compromise on providing corruption-free building permission and other services to the citizens. “The commissioners will be dismissed from services, not just suspension, if they are found guilty,” he said during a meeting with commissioners of newly-created municipalities and town planning wing staff on Thursday

Stating that the state government was giving priority for both sanitation and greenery, the minister said every municipality should have both green plan and sanitation plan for their respective urban local bodies. Apart from these plans, -the urban local bodies should give preference for online services, grievance redressal and corruption-free building permissions, he added.

“The commissioners have to supervise sanitation works from 4.30am every day for better environment. To control seasonal diseases in their respective municipalities, they can have health plans,” KTR said.

The ministers said the new Municipalities Act should be implemented letter and spirit in the state. KTR gave an overview of the new Municipal Act, which was aimed to provide fast, transparent, and corruption-free governance, and urged the officers to implement it effectively. He said the municipal commissioners should ensure proper drinking water supply, sanitation maintenance and an increase in green cover in urban local bodies by earmarking 10% budget for greenery in their respective areas.

“Unlike any other state in the country, the TS-bPass (building permission) will grant permissions to a citizen within 21 days to construct a house. The commissioners should ensure permissions be given within the stipulated time,” KTR said.

The minister asked the officials to come up with innovative programmes to level up sanitation works in the municipalities. He instructed the officials to increase the number of public toilets and SHE toilets for women in the corporations and municipalities.

Title: HC raps state for non-implementation of law to prevent and tackle fires
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Mumbai: The Bombay high court on Monday frowned at the state government for not implementing a law to prevent and tackle fires, 14 years after it came into force.

A bench of Justices Satyaranjan Dharmadhikari and Riyaz Chagla heard a public interest litigation (PIL) that sought the implementation of the National Building Code of India norms , amongs other reliefs, by amending the development control regulation.

The judges questioned how the government was implementing the Maharashtra Fire Prevention and Safety Measures Act, 2006. “How are you enforcing the law?” asked Justice Dharmadhikari. Jagtiani pointed out that the act has an overriding effect on other laws. “Compliance with other laws will not be deemed to be compliance with that of the act,” he added.

The judges said the act is comprehensive and talks of prevention and life saving. Adjourning the hearing to Thursday, the bench said the assistance of the Maharashtra Legal Services Authority at the state and that at the district, Mumbai city and suburban levels may be taken to create awareness.

Title: Goa public debt will hit Rs 17,952 crore by March 2021
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Representative image

PANAJI: The budget for 2020-21 shows that Goa’s public debt continues to march upwards and is expected to hit Rs 17,952 crore, or 19.46%, of the gross state domestic product (GSDP) by March 2021. The documents also indicate that public debt for the current fiscal is likely to hit Rs 16,472 crore. This does not include the government’s internal debt, which is estimated at an additional Rs 6,000 crore.

The economic survey for 2019-20, released a day earlier, stated that the public debt for the current fiscal would be Rs 15,008 crore. The gross fiscal deficit for 2020-21 is estimated at 2.01% or Rs 1,856.65 crore, which is within the prescribed norm of 3% of the GSDP.

Sawant projected outstanding liabilities through state bonds will stand at Rs 14,110 crore, while loans from Nabard will hit Rs 765 crore.

“The liabilities have grown gradually, but the sustained public expenditure by the state has a high multiplier effect on the economy. The outstanding debt is expected to remain under the ceiling set by the Fiscal Responsibility and Budget Management,” the chief minister said.

In his budget speech, Sawant made it clear that central taxes form a major share of the state’s revenue. Acknowledging Goa’s rising liabilities, he said he would endeavour to contain the expenditure for essential purposes without compromising on the state’s welfare.

Title: Telangana wants Centre to procure more red gram
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

HYDERABAD: The Telangana government has requested the Centre to allow Markfed to purchase red gram 54,000 metric tons more than the quota of 47,500 metric tons allowed for the state.

With the red gram production in the state increasing to 2.7 lakh metric tonnes, the TRS government has written a letter to the central government requesting that the procurment agency be directed to purchase an additional 54,000 metric tons.

During a review meeting with officials on Thursday, agriculture minister S Niranjan Reddy said more produce needs to be purchased as red gram farmers were facing problems. The purchase arrangements have to be completed after elections to agricultural cooperative societies. The minister directed the officials to ensure there was no delay in supply of urea in the state.

Title: File charges against MLA: Porvorim Congress
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

SALIGAO: While the Congress legislature party came out strongly in support of Porvorim MLA Rohan Khaunte , Porvorim block Congress committee demanded that chargesheet be filed against the two-time Independent MLA for the “assault” on a BJP functionary.

Addressing a news conference at Mapusa, Porvorim Block Congress president Shankar Phadte said, “This political thug has become frustrated. We strongly condemn this kind of act within the precincts of the assembly and demand that a chargesheet be filed against the MLA within 30 days after examining all the witnesses and recording their statements.”

Khaunte was elected for the second time in 2017 with the backing of the Congress. But he extended support to the BJP though Congress was the single largest party. In return, he was rewarded with revenue and IT portfolios. He was dropped from the Pramod Sawant cabinet in July 2019.

Title: Nagpur: 100-fold rise in birth, death certificate seekers in 3 months, 83% Muslims
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

A general view of NMC's birth and death registration department

NAGPUR: The number of people visiting the birth and death registration department of Nagpur Municipal Corporation (NMC) has shot up exponentially in the last three months, soon after talk of the National Register of Citizens ( NRC ) and the Citizenship Amendment Act ( CAA ) gripped the nation.

Officials say that from not more than three to four daily queries, the number has jumped to 300-340 visitors daily. In January, 5,581 citizens visited the department searching for birth and death certificates-related issues. Of this, 4,643 were Muslims.

The number of non-Muslims too — though in double digits only — is considerably higher than before, when very few people would trickle in to the office through the day.

A bulk of these people belong to the lower and middle income groups. Officials are having a hard time explaining the nitty-grittier of the process to them.

Those unable to decipher which identity proofs and supporting documents are needed for processing of their applications have been doing the rounds of the NMC headquarters in Civil Lines.

The NMC department had not bothered to maintain a visitor’s register earlier, given the scant footfalls. After the sustained recent rush at the office, however, officials have decided to keep a count of citizens coming there for name corrections, additions and seeking birth and death certificates.

The department is witnessing heavy rush everyday, particularly during morning hours. On Thursday, when TOI visited the department, harried citizens were seen queued up at the lone window manned by two officials.

Roohi Abid, a resident of Pili Nadi on Kamptee Road, has been coming for two days to get the death certificate of her grandfather Hussain Baig, who died in 1963. “We have dadajaan’s school leaving certificate, but need his death certificate to establish that we have been living here for three generations,” Roohi says.

Vegetable seller Munni Begum needs the birth certificates of her two kids. “I have been coming here for two weeks, but the records have not been found,” she said.

Munni was informed about the process to be followed when records are not found, yet she is unable to understand what is needed.

Similarly, Haseena Begum has been told about the process. “I am coming here for more than 15 days, but they are not showing me the records,” she states.

Several others like them are in a state of panic.

Daily wager Nathu Dongre, a resident of Somwari Quarters in east Nagpur, says he came for the addition of his son’s name in the birth certificate. “He was born in 1992. I never felt the need to do so, but now it is important,” he said, without referring to the NRC-CAA controversy.

“This is just to keep a record,” Dongre adds, pointing towards the large number of Muslims around him.

Title: Five men booked for manhandling Uttarakhand cops in UP village
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Representative image

MUZAFFARNAGAR: Five persons were booked for allegedly manhandling members of Uttarakhand police team who were in Muzaffarnagar district to arrest an accused involved in an excise related case which was reportedly pending in the neighbouring hill state, the police said on Thursday.

The five persons also included the man, identified as Dharmender Sharma, whom the Uttarakhand cops came to arrest and got involved in a scuffle. Sources said the incident occurred late on Wednesday at Mandla village in Purkazi near Uttar Pradesh-Uttarakhand border. Soon, the accused Dharmender Sharma and his four other associates fled from the village.

Dharmender has been accused in a case - under the Excise Act - in Uttarakhand’s Devprayag town. Sources added that some villagers intervened and started manhandling the police team when Dharmender was being taken away by the visiting cops.

The local police have registered a case at Purkazi police station against Dharmender and four others Mohit Sharma, Budhu, Mange Ram and Pupu.

Station house officer of Purkazi police station, Pankaj Tyagi, said, “A case has been registered under various sections against Dharmender and others. Probe is currently on. Action will be taken accordingly.”

Title: Gujarat: Displaced hawkers detained for protesting sans permission
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

The ‘Happy Street’ at Law Garden ahead of its inauguration

AHMEDABAD: Police in the city on Wednesday afternoon booked eight hawkers, who earlier did business near Law Garden, at what will soon become a designated food vending area called ‘Happy Street’, for protesting against the AMC for displacing them.

Navrangpura police officials said the hawkers had been booked for organizing a protest without police permission and had been detained under Section 188 of the IPC. A similar incident took place on Thursday, and resulted in a fracas between an encroachment removal team of AMC and police officials, and protesting hawkers near Vastrapur lake .

V A Parmar, sub-inspector of Law Garden chowky in the FIR stated that they had been deployed in bandobust to remove encroachments from ‘Happy Street’ when a group of 30-35 hawkers, waving banners against the AMC arrived from Navrangpura and began airing their grievances in public.

They had no permission to organize a protest and were detained, said a police official. “Rakesh, the president of All-India Hawkers Union was detained along with Alpesh, Paresh Dayaram, Bharat Tolaji , Manubhai Bhupatsinh, Premkumar Ramprasad, Dinesh Bhavan and Satish Nekram,” said a police official.

At Vastrapur lake, cops and officials of the Ahmedabad Municipal Corporation (AMC) faced stiff opposition from hawkers when they set out to remove encroachments in the area on Thursday morning. Some 50 hawkers, including women, gathered at the spot and resisted the efforts of the cops and AMC officials.

Some of them allegedly abused the cops and got into scuffles with them.

As police reinforcement were called in, the hawkers dispersed. Police booked 14 people, including the leader of the group, Rakesh Maheriya, and six women.

“Two of our policemen suffered minor injuries. We have booked 14 persons under Sections 186, 323, 332, 143, 147 and 149 of the IPC,” said a police official.

Title: Donald Trump's visit: Gujarat eyes US consulate
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Donald Trump. (Photo: AP)

GANDHINAGAR: The state government has asked the central government to request US to set up a consulate in Gujarat .

This has been a long pending demand of the state considering the high number of Gujaratis settled in the US.

Gujaratis are one of the largest sub-groups of the Indian diaspora in the US and large numbers of people from the state who are seeking US visas currently have to travel to Mumbai.

A senior official in the state government said that although the Gujarat government is yet to receive formal instructions from Centre about President Trump’s Gujarat visit, security, logistics and other preparations for it have begun. “The state government requested the Centre to ask the US government to consider the long-pending demand of the Gujarati community for a US consulate and visa centre in Ahmedabad or Gandhinagar , so residents of Gujarat do not have to travel to Mumbai for visas.”

The official added that a large number of visa applicants are senior citizens who visit the US often to meet family members.

“If Gujarat gets a consulate and visa centre, it will also boost support for the Trump administration among the Gujarati diaspora,” the source said.

The US presently has consulates in New Delhi, Chennai, Hyderabad, Kolkata and Mumbai. Applicants for US visa aspirants from Gujarat, Diu, Daman and Dadra and Nagar Haveli have to travel to Mumbai.

Prafull Nayak, president (India), Association of Indian Americans in the North America (AIANA) said, “The Gujarati community in the US has always been in support of the Trump administration. President Trump’s family had extended its support to organizing the ‘Chalo Gujarat’ event when it was first started in 2008.”

He added that the Gujarati community – both in India and in the US – have been requesting the US government to open a consulate and visa centre either in Ahmedabad or Gandhinagar.

“A number of investors from US regularly visit Gujarat and the people of Gujarat have also been exploring business opportunities in the US. If such a facility comes up in Gujarat, it will be a win-win situation for both parties,” he said.

AIANA had earlier taken up a signature campaign, seeking a US consulate in Gujarat, which was endorsed by more than 8,000 Gujaratis living in the US.

“We request the Centre to take up the issue with President Trump during his Ahmedabad and India visit. It will further cement ties between the two countries,’’ Nayak added.

Title: Goa: BJP wants former revenue minister Rohan Khaunte to be disqualified
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

SALIGAO: The North Goa BJP mandal on Thursday demanded that Porvorim MLA and former revenue minister Rohan Khaunte be immediately disqualified as MLA for threatening the party’s spokesperson, Premanand Mahambre .

Mandal president Mahanand Asnodkar told reporters that Khaunte’s actions were “highly condemnable”.

“If an elected representative violated the law in the place that is meant to make the laws, this sets a wrong precedent for the people,” Asnodkar said. “Whatever action has to be initiated, will be taken. We are confident that the government will give us justice.”

Asnodkar further said that Khaunte’s disqualification would set an example to all the other MLA’s on how they should behave.

Earlier in the day, the Porvorim BJP block committee protested at Porvorim Tisk to condemn Khaunte’s actions.

Title: BJP workers burn effigy in Bicholim
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Bicholim: BJP workers from Bicholim, Mayem and Sakhali constituencies burned an effigy of Porvorim MLA Rohan Khaunte on Wednesday to protest against his alleged assault on a senior BJP functionary from Bicholim taluka, Premanand Mahambre and using foul language against him. The protest was held near the Bicholim KTC bus stand on Wednesday.

Mayem zilla panchayat member Shankar Chodankar termed Khaunte’s act as “serious and criminal” in nature, and that he should have “sorted out the issue verbally instead of physically assaulting a senior citizen”.

Title: Goa budget 2020: Four major projects to strengthen health sector
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Representative image

PANAJI: Chief minister Pramod Sawant said the super-specialty and cancer research centre, Margao district hospital and Chicalim Cottage hospital, will strengthen the health sector.

Of the four major projects under construction, at least three are slated to be completed in 2020. In his budget speech on Thursday, the finance minister said the South Goa district hospital will be linked to a medical college to be operated on private public partnership (PPP) mode.

He said health infrastructure will also be strengthened. Under the National Ayush Mission, he said that an Ayush mental healthcare clinic will be set up.

He also proposed to construct a hostel to accommodate postgraduate dental students of Goa Dental College and Hospital, as also an MPhil in clinical psychology from the next academic year.

The chief minister did not announce any new big project for public health.

The budget provision for the sector also did not see a major jump with a provision of Rs 822 crore. This is Rs 53 crore more vis-a-vis Rs 769 crore in 2019-20.

The super-specialty block which is nearing completion, and the cancer research centre, are partly funded by the Centre. Other projects which are under way are funded by the state.

Title: Goa budget: Now, December 2021 target for Zuari bridge
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Barely three days after PWD minister Deepak Pauskar told the House that the new Zuari bridge would be complete in April 2021, chief minister Pramod Sawant pushed the target to December 2021, indicating a seven-month delay.

The Rs 1,400-crore project, arguably Goa’s most expensive ever, was originally set to be commissioned last December.

Title: Mix 25% fly ash in bricks or shut down, admin tells brick kiln owners
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Meerut: District administration has directed all clay brick kiln owners to mix 25% fly ash in brick manufacturing and also erect a six-foot-tall tin sheet fence around the kiln facility. They have been warned that if the steps are not taken, the facilities will be shut down.

Additional district magistrate (finance) Subhash Chand Prajapati said, “We have given strict instructions to all brick kiln manufacturers to either follow rules or shut down their establishment.”

Prajapati said the steps were being taken in accordance with the directions of Allahabad high court. “The direction is in connection with a HC order on a PIL filed way back in 2014. The HC eventually ordered on January 23, 2020 that unless the above mentioned provisions are not fulfilled, no kiln should be allowed to manufacture bricks.”

Brick kiln owners, on the other hand, claimed that the group which filed the PIL believes in blackmailing tactics and misled the court to obtain orders in its favour.

CP Singh, president of the district brick kiln association, told TOI, “We will challenge the order in the HC because of the half-baked information provided by the petitioners. First of all, fly ash is made available by the thermal power plants. And these plants had already made it clear way back in 2010 that they do not have fly ash available in adequate quantity for brick kilns, which means the HC order in the current status amounts to sounding death knell for brick kiln industry.”

Environmental activist and lawyer Gaurav Bansal has rejected the claims of the brick kiln industry. “There is no dearth of fly ash in and around these thermal power plants but the problem is that already established clay brick kilns are not in the vicinity of these plants, so the transportation cost of fly ash from plant to kiln is quite high. On the contrary, clay is easily available. So the brick manufactures shy away from using fly ash.”

Fly ash is a by-product of coal after it is burnt at thermal power plants. There has been quite a push to promote its usage in brick manufacturing as thermal plants dump this ash on empty land or ponds, leading to depletion in top soil and raising pollution levels in the atmosphere. But inconsistent supply of this ash to brick kilns is matter of concern.

Title: Goa: IIT at Sattari to get addl 2.4 lakh sqm land
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

PANAJI: The cabinet on Thursday approved an additional 2.4 lakh sqm of land at Melaulim-Gulelim in Sattari for the establishment of the Indian Institute of Technology IIT).

The land, which will be transferred free of cost, is in addition to the 10 lakh sqm already allotted for the campus.

The cabinet, however, declined to grant another 3.6 lakh sqm of land. Instead, it has permitted an increase in floor area ratio (FAR) for the construction, calling the IIT a special project.

Approval has also been granted for an access road to the site. A single-lane road from the Guleli high school to the Sateri temple will be converted into a two-lane road.

This, as well as work of laying a drinking water pipeline to the site, will be undertaken by the public works department (PWD) at its own cost.

The Union human resource development ministry (MHRD) had asked the state government to consider allotting additional land, adjoining the 240 acres inspected earlier.

The site selection committee had inspected the 240-acre site at Melaulim-Gulelim, for which the ministry had given conditional approval. The state had previously attempted to acquire land in Cortali in Sanguem and Nagvem in Quepem . However, as parts of this land was privately-owned, the state was facing a challenge in convincing locals to part with their property.

The land now earmarked in Sattari taluka is being viewed as a safe option as it belongs to the state revenue department.

The land requirement to set up the permanent IIT campus was originally 500 acres. Given the state’s limited land resources, former CM Manohar Parrikar had clarified that only around 300 acres would be allocated. IIT Goa currently functions out of the Goa College of Engineering at Farmagudi.

Title: Rohan Khaunte: Pramod Sawant unhappy with opposition’s role
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Rohan Khaunte

PORVORIM: The opposition’s role is to expose the government on the floor of the House and I think that it has not gone well with chief minister Pramod Sawant, Porvorim MLA Rohan Khaunte said on Thursday.

They must have planned this, he said. “First they started with a personal attack. We all have legal businesses,” the MLA said.

Khaunte said that BJP spokesperson Premanand Mahambre is known to me. He should not have stooped to such low-level politics, he said.

Khaunte said, “The government calls itself the government of the common man, but after my arrest I don’t know what will happen to the common man.”

Title: Traders fined for using plastic
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

KOLHAPUR: The Kollhapur Municipal Corporation (KMC) on Wednesday initiated action against 14 traders in the city and recovered Rs 70,000 fine for using banned plastic. The action was taken in the Mahalaxmi temple premises and Gujari. Each trader was fined Rs 5,000 for using banned plastic.

March for demands of pensioners

Sarva Shramik Sangh took out a march to raise various demands of pensioners. The protesters demanded increase in the dearness allowance, transfer of funds to legal heirs after death husband or wife and increase in the pension up to Rs 3,000.

Residents demand water supply , threaten agitation

Residents of the Fulewadi ring road area have threatened to launch an agitation if the water supply was not restored immediately. They submitted a memorandum to municipal commissioner Mallinath Kalshetti complaining that the water supply to the area was disrupted for more than two months. The memorandum stated that more than 300 families were affected due to the lack of regular water supply.

Title: 49 of 56 people who returned from China last month under scanner in Meerut
Content:
Representative image

MEERUT: In the wake of the outbreak of novel coronavirus (2019-nCoV) in China, Meerut health department had till Thursday located 49 of the 56 people who returned from that country last month. They are closely being monitored for any symptoms that might appear. The process to locate the others is on. At the same time, three samples of suspected coronavirus which were sent to a Lucknow laboratory have tested negative.Across the world, people who have visited China recently are being placed under quarantine or being closely monitored to check the spread of the disease.“We had sent the samples of three suspected cases which showed symptoms of coronavirus to Lucknow for testing. All three of them have tested negative, the reports of which were received here. However, we have put all those who returned from China last month under the scanner and are keeping a check on their symptoms,” said Dr Raj Kumar, Meerut chief medical officer.It should be noted that from December 31, 2019 till February 1, 2020, as many as 56 people were identified as having returned from China to Meerut. Out of these 56, as many as 49 people have been located and others are yet to be located at their addresses. “We are in the process of locating the remaining people who returned from China and all of them are being checked for symptoms. If any person shows suspected symptoms, a sample will be sent for checking,” said Dr Kumar.“One should not panic in the backdrop of coronavirus, and should rather focus on keeping clean surroundings and washing their hands from time to time to prevent any infection. While there is no cure of coronavirus until now, but isolating the patient and putting the patients on antibiotics to prevent secondary infections is a way that it will be dealt with currently,” said Dr Kumar.

Title: Price of feni to reach new high
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Goa’s famed Feni is heading for a high of a different kind with the state government increasing the excise duty on the locally-crafted fruity brew from Rs 100 to Rs 155 per litre.

The heritage liquor, which is popular among locals and gaining traction abroad, is set to witness a significant increase in its retail prices as dealers will have no choice but to pass on the excise duty hike to tipplers.

The hike in excise duty is effective on all country liquor that is priced between Rs 110 to Rs 500 for a 750ml bottle. Feni got a geographical indication (GI) as well as the heritage tag to boost sales. tnn

Title: Metro completion delayed by three months
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Nagpur: There will be a slight delay in completion of Nagpur Metro project as the deadline has been extended till March 2021 against the earlier one of December 2020. MahaMetro officials ascribed various reasons for the delay. Reach I (Sitabuldi to Khapri) and Reach III (Sitabuldi to Lokmanya Nagar) are already operational although half the stations are yet to be opened.

A Metro official said that both Reach II (Sitabuldi to Automotive Square stretch) and Reach IV (Sitabuldi to Prajapati Nagar stretch) would be completed by March 2021. These deadlines have been submitted to Prime Minister’s office (PMO) and chief minister’s office (CMO). Earlier, Reach IV was to be completed first and Reach II was the last.

Elaborating on the status of Reach IV, the official said, “Work of viaduct is 82% complete. All the 1,284 piles, 250 pile caps, 45 pier arms, 44 track arms and 2,393 segment casting have been completed. 245 piers out of 266, 221 pier caps out of 232, 5 out of 35 portals 2,266 segment erection out of 2,393, 217 out of 259 span erections and 232 out of 250 crash barrier fixing have been completed.”

Metro track has been laid on 4 kilometre out of the total 8.5km. Overhead electrical poles will be erected after track laying is completed.

On Reach II, he said, “207 out of 221 pile caps, 188 out of 221 piers up to Metro level, 181 out of 221 pier caps up to Metro level, 124 spans out of 220, 994 out of 1,655 spine casting and 75 out of 160 spine launching have been completed. Wing casting and launching has also started. Track has been laid on 1km.”

MahaMetro may have set a deadline of March 2021 but Nagpurians may not be able to use Metro on these stretches from April 2021 if experience of Reach III is anything to go by. Reach III had been completed in September 2019 but was opened for traffic in January 2020 as MahaMetro could not get the appointment of Prime Minister Narendra Modi and chief minister Uddhav Thackeray. Finally both didn’t come to Nagpur and the CM inaugurated it through video link.

Title: Mayoral poll: Ajarekar & Pagar to clash
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Kolhapur: Monday’s mayoral election is expected to have a straight contest between Nilofer Ajarekar of Congress-NCP and BJP-Tararani Aaghadi’s Archana Pagar . Ajarekar and Pagar filed their nomination papers on Thursday.

Kolhapur is all set to have another mayor after four months as per a Congress decision. NCP’s Surmanjiri Latkar resigned from the post a few days back to pave the way for a Congress mayor as per the understanding between the two parties. Sources in Congress said the party has decided to give an opportunity to another corporator before November this year when the civic election will be held. Congress has decided to give a chance to a corporator from Kolhapur South and Kolhapur North following pressure from members.

Nilofer Ajarekar is from Kolhapur North. Sources said that another corporator from Kolhapur South will be given opportunity after four months. Ajarekar has been asked to resign after four months, they said. Sources added that district guardian minister Satej Patil was of the view that one corporator should hold the mayoral post for the remaining nine-month period. However, he had to succumb to pressure from corporators. Apart from Ajarekar, Jayshree Chavan and Uma Banchhode were strong contenders. From Kolhapur South, Deepa Magdum and Indumati Mane were aspirants. Satej Patil had conducted separate interviews of all the aspirants before finalizing the candidate. Sharandhar Deshmukh announced the candidature of Ajarekar in the noon after which nomination papers were filed.

BJP-Tararani Aaghadi finalized Pagar’s name after a meeting of local leaders.

Title: Thread tied to baby’s neck for good luck turns into death trap
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Representative image

MUZAFFARNAGAR: In a freak accident, a one-year-old baby died after hanging from the thread tied around his neck for good luck which actually got entangled in his pram when he fell down with no parents to check on him on Thursday morning. The parents later took the child to a hospital, where he was declared dead.

The incident occurred at Garhi Daulat village of Kandhla police station in Shamli when parents left their one-year-old son unattended for a while and went to the terrace. When they returned to check their child, he was found unconscious hanging from the pram.

The baby’s father, who is a labourer, said, “He was sleeping in a pram. I don’t know how he fell and got entangled in his pram.”

Notably, a similar incident occurred in Shamli district last year. A five-year-old boy drowned after he accidentally fell into a temporarily dug tank in an under-construction building. The incident took place at Noorani colony under Sadar Kotwali . By the time his body was found, he was already dead. Sources said, the boy was playing outside the under-construction building and suddenly fell into the tank.

In another such incident in Muzaffarnagar last June, a seven-year-old boy had accidentally locked himself inside a car while he was on way to a local madrassa. Unable to come out, the boy was found dead a few hours later probably due to suffocation. The incident took place at Sikri village of Muzaffarnagar’s Bhopa region.

Title: After MeeSeva staff, fair price shop dealers fear for future
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Visakhapatnam: Fair price shop dealers will soon become mere stockists as from April onwards, as volunteers and secretaries will distribute essential stock to the general public. In all, there are over 29,000 fair price shop dealers catering to an average of 500 card holders each.

The state government’s proposal to use the fair price shop dealers as stockists has them worrying for their future as they believe their days are numbered. The dealers’ association is pleading with the government to provide them a monthly allowance that would help them tide over their losses.

“The government proposes to provide us Rs 1 per kilo of essentials distributed. This sum is a pittance as it averages to roughly Rs 7,000 for the seven tonnes of essentials that we disburse every month, averaging to 14 kilos per card (taking into account the average three individuals per card). Out of this amount, as stockists we have to pay our staff, stock room rent and electricity bills. This is nothing but shoving us into losses,” said P Chitti Raju, general secretary of the fair price shop dealers association.

In lieu of the losses they will incur, the members of the association have demanded a compensatory sum of Rs 12,000 for rural dealers, Rs 15,000 for dealers in municipalities and Rs 18,000 for dealers in corporations. M Venkata Rao, the president of the association, said, “We understand that as stockists our role will merely be that of safe-keepers of the stock. Keeping this in mind, we are asking for a reasonable sum as monthly allowance.”

The dealers pointed out that the government’s move would be a fatal blow, keeping in mind the sheer number of dealers in the state. They added that the introduction of the EPoS (E-Point of Distribution System) has made the PDS (public distribution system) by far the best in the country and handing over stock distribution to volunteers could actually prove to be regressive.

Title: Private universities bill will help make Goa education hub: CM Pramod Sawant
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Goa University

PANAJI: With the focus of imparting qualitative and industry-relevant higher education, chief minister Pramod Sawant on Thursday introduced the Goa Private Universities Bill , 2020, that will allow institutes affiliated to private universities to set up campuses in the state. At present, the state has just one university— Goa University .

The CM had said the bill would help Goa become an educational hub. Sawant said the expenditure involved cannot be quantified at this stage, but estimated that approximately Rs 1 crore would be required per annum to operate it.

Goa governor Satya Pal Malik also recommended the introduction and consideration of the bill.

Establishment of a university will be allowed on the following conditions—the sponsoring body will be required to create a permanent endowment fund of at least Rs 5 crore, own the land, building and infrastructure facilities required for establishing a university, appoint at least one professor, two associate professors and a sufficient number of assistant professors and support staff in every department or discipline.

To set up a university, an application containing the proposal and the project report will be made by the sponsoring body to the government through the director of higher education, along with the fee prescribed by the government.

To evaluate the proposal, the director of higher education will constitute a committee consisting of the minister of higher education as chairman, and the committee will submit its report to the director within three months of the date of its constitution.

The university will be open to persons of all genders and of every race, creed, caste, or class, and will not be lawful for the university to impose on any person any test whatsoever of their religious belief or profession in order to grant them admission.

The president, vice-chancellor, pro vice-chancellor, registrar, dean of faculty, controller of examinations, finance officer and others will be the officers of the universities.

Title: Telangana: Hajipur serial rapist-killer Marri Srinivas Reddy sentenced to death
Content:
Marri Srinivas Reddy

Court examined 101 witnesses, DNA evidence

(The victim's identity has not been revealed to protect her privacy as per Supreme court directives on cases related to sexual assault)

HYDERABAD: A special court in Nalgonda on Thursday gave the death penalty to Marri Srinivas Reddy after convicting him of raping and killing three minor girls in Hajipur village in Yadadri Bhuvanagiri district .The 28-year-old lift mechanic had raped and killed three girls, aged 11, 13, and 17. While the 17-year-old victim was killed in 2015, the other two were killed last year. He was given the death sentence in two cases and life imprisonment in another case. The verdict has come barely nine months after he was arrested in the case on April 30, 2019. The trial began on October 14.Since August 2019, this is the third death sentence that a fast track court in Telangana has pronounced in a rape and murder case. Only on January 30, a fast track court in Adilabad had sentenced three men to death for raping and killing a tribal woman at Yellapattar in Kumarumbheem Asifabad district.First additional district and sessions judge SVV Nath Reddy, who was designated Pocso court judge and fast track court judge, pronounced the punishment in the Hajipur case and asked the convict if he had anything to say. Refusing to admit to his guilt, Srinivas Reddy said: “I have been forced to admit to a crime which I did not commit. The police tortured me. I have to take care of my aged parents.”Srinivas broke down in the court soon after the judge pronounced the verdict.Besides death, the judge also sentenced him under various sections of the Criminal Procedure Code to 57 years in jail and a fine of ?5,000.The court examined 101 witnesses and also took into account DNA evidence. The police filed three different chargesheets in the three cases.Special public prosecutor K Chandrasekhar had asked for the death penalty treating the crime as ‘rarest of rare’. Legal counsel for the convict, provided by the legal services authority, Rabindranath Tagore, defended Srinivas Reddy saying that he was not even at the scene of the crime when it was alleged to have been committed.Srinivas Reddy was arrested a few days after a 13-year-old girl’s body was found in a well in Hajipur. A forensic examination had confirmed that the girl was raped and murdered.

Title: Kolhapur: Valuables worth Rs 72,000 stolen
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Representative image

KOLHAPUR: Two incidents of house break-ins have been registered with two different police stations in the district in which the suspects broke open the locks of houses and decamped with valuables worth Rs 72,000.

In the first incident registered with the Chandgad police station, unidentified suspects broke into the house of Subhash Anna Patade in Vinzane village between January 7 and February 3 and decamped with the valuables worth Rs 60,000, including gold jewellery.

The complainant told police that he was not at home at the time of incident. Police said that they are investigating the case in details.

In another incident registered with the Shahuwadi police station, unidentified people broke into a closed house between February 2 and February 4 and decamped with valuables worth Rs 12,000. The complainant, Namdev Alawekar, told police that he was not at home at the time of incident.

Police said that they have invoked sections 454(lurking house-trespass or house-breaking in order to commit offence punishable with imprisonment), 457 (lurking house trespass or house-breaking by night in order to commit offence punishable with imprisonment) and 380 (theft in dwelling house) of the Indian Penal Code against the suspects and have launched a search operation to nab the suspects involved in the crimes.

Title: Nearly 20-month extension for Mopa project
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

The state cabinet on Thursday extended the September 2020 deadline that was set for the completion of greenfie... Read More

PANAJI: The state cabinet on Thursday extended the September 2020 deadline that was set for the completion of greenfield international airport at Mopa by 20 months, owing to delays caused by litigations.

A senior government officer said that as per the new deadline, the infrastructure at the airport will have to be completed by December 2021 and the operations would begin by May-end, 2022.

He said that it takes at least six months to get permission and clearances from all the authorities to start operations after the infrastructure is in place.

The government had signed the concession agreement with GMR Goa for developing the airport on a public-private partnership basis on November 8, 2016.

The three-year construction period of phase I began from September 4, 2017 with the commercial operations date fixed on September 3, 2020.

The state government had appointed Engineers India Ltd, a government of India entity, to supervise the project’s progress.

The project faced constraints on felling of trees and a 365-day stay on construction by the apex court against the environmental clearance (EC) granted by the ministry of environment, forest and climate change.

The Supreme Court on January 16, 2020 had upheld the environment clearance and allowed the construction work to resume.

“The concessionaire has sought 634 days extension for commissioning of the phase I with corresponding extension in concession period and time for payment of annual premium,” states the cabinet note.

It said that although there was a stay over felling of trees for 167 days, there was no stay on the project. But, the pace of construction slowed down considerably.

“The overall progress achieved during the period of stay on tree felling was 5.3 per cent as against a planned progress of 10.9 per cent,” it said.

Title: In Rajya Sabha, govt objects to SC’s remarks on Speakers, gets Cong’s backing
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

ANI photo

NEW DELHI: Expressing concern at the Supreme Court’s recent observation over the time taken by presiding officers (Speakers) to decide on the disqualification of defected law makers, Union law minister Ravi Shankar Prasad on Thursday said the apex court’s “comments were avoidable”. He said, “With the greatest respect to the honourable Supreme Court, those sweeping comments against the presiding officers, were surely avoidable. We need to have institutional respect for all the institutions of the country. The presiding officers of the legislatures are equally important functionaries in the constitutional process. I must place it on record.”

Congress leader Anand Sharma also supported the minister’s observation say ing, “We should take note of it. I agree with the honourable law minister on this. This is a serious matter. It is a transgression. The Constitution is clear in its scheme of things and the division of powers.” The apex court while hearing a plea on disqualification of 17 MLAs in Karnataka had ruled limiting the time-frame within which the presiding officers — the Speaker or Chairperson — can decide disqualification petitions. It had observed that presiding officers also belong to some political party. Prasad and Sharma’s observation came soon after Rajya Sabha Chairman M Venkaiah Naidu asked the government to find a solution to the “nuisance and unethical” practice of defection of elected political representatives from parent parties to others.

Naidu made the suggestion after DMK MP P Wilson raised the issue of defection during Zero Hour. “Unfortunately, people are saying now it’s not defection, it’s only affection and they are doing it with perfection. We must put an end to this. It is a very im portant issue across the country. Cutting across party lines, we must come forward to suggest some alternative to end this nuisance or nonsense or unethical acts of defection,” Naidu said.

He also said that everybody was taking time to decide on this issue whether presiding officers or courts. Recently, a conference of presiding officers of Parliament and state assemblies was held. The 10th schedule to the Indian Constitution, which is also popularly referred to as the anti-defection law, was discussed at length on the concluding day of the conference.

The discussion on the 10th Schedule assumes importance in the wake of the Supreme Court’s observation about a growing trend of Speakers of legislative bodies acting against the constitutional duty of being neutral.

Title: Panel suggests 3-fold hike in pay of judicial officers
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

NEW DELHI: In a revised pay structure recommended for judicial officers of subordinate courts across the country, the 2nd National Judicial Pay Commission has recommended an almost three-fold increase in the existing starting monthly emoluments of first class magistrate from Rs 27,700 to Rs 77,840 and that of a district judge to Rs 1,44,840.

The highest pay grade of the district judge has been recommended at Rs 2,24,100. The pay of the senior civil judge, the next higher grade to the first class magistrate, has been recommended to be raised to Rs 1,11,000.

The increase in pay and pension of the judicial officers have been recommended to take effect from January 1, 2016 with arrears to be paid within this year.

The National Judicial Pay Commission, headed by former Supreme Court judge P V Reddy, was set up on the directions of the apex court in May 2017 during the of hearing of the All India Judges Association case.

A law ministry release said that the percentage of selection grade and super time scale of district judges be increased by 10% and 5% respectively.

The commission has further recommended pension at 50% of last drawn pay with effect from January 1, 2016, while the the family pension will be 30% of the last drawn pay.

"Additional quantum of pension to commence on completing the age of 75 years (instead of 80 years) and percentages at various stages thereafter are increased. The existing ceiling of retirement gratuity and death gratuity to be increased by 25% when the DA reaches 50% ," the commission said.

"Recommendation has been made to discontinue the New Pension Scheme (NPS) which is being applied to those entering service during or after 2004. The old pension system, which is more beneficial, to be revived," it said.

The commission has further increased the existing allowances and added certain new features. However, the City Compensatory Allowance (CCA) is proposed to be discontinued.

Title: Kolhapur: Biker dead in accident involving sugar cane trailer
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Representative image

KOLHAPUR: A 50-year-old biker was killed on Tuesday when he hit a parked tractor trailer laden with sugar cane along a road in Appachi wadi, around 40 km south of the city.

This is the third accident this season in which a sugar cane vehicle has been found involved.

Steven Alvares, the regional transport officer, Kolhapur , told TOI that his office will wait for the police investigation to conclude before deciding who was at fault. “Prima facie, it seems like the sugar cane vehicle was at fault. But we do not want to make any assumptions at this stage. We will have to know if the biker was following rules,” Alvares said.

On January 24, two people were killed when the Omni they were traveling in — carrying six members of a family — rammed into a sugar cane trailer in the same Appachi wadi area. At the time, the officials at the regional transport office had said that they would launch road safety awareness campaigns among sugar cane trailer drivers, who have been accused of negligence. Every year, there are fatal accidents involving vehicles ferrying raw sugar cane to the mills, especially along the highway stretches through Pune, Solapur, Nashik and Ahmednagar. The vehicles usually don’t have any rear lights and are often overloaded, with produce dangerously sticking out of the cargo bays. The tail lights in most instances are covered by the sugar cane stems.

Alvares said the mills in the region had already been informed that they would be held responsible if sugar cane vehicles were found to have caused accidents.

“We have held workshops across the district with sugar mill owners and farmers. We are also carrying our regular patrolling,” he said.

Earlier in 2019, Alvares had said that as many as 4,535 vehicles were inspected for the reflector violation from April 1 to November 30, of which, 907 were found to be non-compliant. A fine of Rs 6.81 lakh was collected from the violators. He had then said that the authorities had planned an enforcement drive across the district to identify the violators and impose fines on them.

Title: 11 tigers using NH-7 underpasses, says WII report
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Nagpur: At a time insufficient mitigation measures on NH-44 (NH-7) near Pench Tiger Reserve have come in for criticism, a report by Wildlife Institute of India (WII), Dehradun, claims 11 individuals tigers are using six of the nine wildlife underpasses.

The report, based on one-year camera trap survey data from March-December 2019, states that 18 wild animal species, excluding rhesus macaque and grey langur, were found using these underpasses. Over 5,450 wild animal captures were recorded on camera traps in 10 months.

NH-7 has been in the news for frequent wild animal deaths. In the latest, a leopard was knocked dead on January 24 near Deolapar. In the last 15 months, three leopards have been killed, and a tiger was recorded jumping over the crash barrier to cross towards Pench Tiger Reserve.

As per the WII report, apart from tigers and leopards, spotted deer, wild boars and wild dogs were the most frequent users of these underpasses. The other animals included jungle cat, mongoose, common palm civet, small Indian civet, Indian hare, rusty spotted cat, and porcupine.

“Till December 31, 89 tiger crossings have been recorded under the mitigation structures. These crossings correspond to 11 individual tigers, that are also regular users of the underpasses,” the report says.

The NH-7 is the longest highway of India, and is part of the north-south corridor connecting Srinagar to Kanyakumari. Along its course, it connects several important urban and rural centres of economic importance. It also cuts across important animal corridors along its route.

Along a 16.1km length of the NH-7 passing through forests adjoining Pench Tiger Reserve and intersecting the Pench-Navegaon-Nagzira tiger corridor, nine wildlife mitigation structures were constructed as proposed in the WII-NTCA joint report in May 2015.

“The initial results from monitoring of mitigation measures on NH-7 are very promising. We have reported 5,381 captures of 18 wild animal species from these underpasses, of which jungle cat, hare, chital, wild pig, wild dog and tiger were found to use these structures most frequently,” said tiger scientist Bilal Habib, who suggested the mitigation measures.

Habib added, “Moreover, 11 tiger individuals are using these structures regularly. The monitoring exercise has shown that these crossing structures are contributing to enhancing the permeability of the landscape. Such mitigation measures, if adopted, would help defragment fragmented landscapes.”

“Learnings from our monitoring exercise can help guide implementation of such mitigation measures in highways passing through ecologically-sensitive habitats across India to make them permeable for wildlife. These findings also add new dimensions to the debate of conservation versus development,” Habib said.

“Habituation to the crossing structures and frequency of captures would vary with local abundance and behaviour of different species. This is reflected by the time they were first captured using the structures and the frequency with which they use the structures,” he explains.

According to the findings, tiger, spotted deer, wild boars, hare and jungle cat were among the first species to be captured under the structures and are regularly captured. Leopard, sloth bear and rusty spotted cat were captured much later during the monitoring.

Tigers have been regularly using six of the 9 underpasses that range from 80 metres to 750 metres in width. Three individuals were also recorded crossing a box culvert of 7 metres width. In addition to crossing the structures, tigers were also observed walking under the structures on 23 occasions.

Title: T commission meet on fund devolution
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Hyderabad: The newly elected chairpersons of the municipal bodies asked for start-up grants to the new municipalities, increase in the per-capita grant and timely release of the assigned revenue for efficient functioning.

In the meeting held by state finance commission on Thursday, they also stressed the need for the powers on various subjects enshrined under 74th amendment of the constitution so that there would be more political and administrative control over departments such as public health and sanitation. TNN

Title: One business family scion slapped with Pocso in Kolkata
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Representative image

KOLKATA: One of the two youths, members of two prominent Kolkata business families, who were arrested for allegedly extorting money from women after threatening to make public intimate moments captured with them on video, has been slapped with stringent Pocso sections.

The accused Anish Loharuka’s family runs a hotel chain in the city and he was arrested with Aditya Aggarwal whose family owns an ethnic-wear retail chain. They were the main accused of the case and produced in court on Thursday. Both of them were remanded in six-day police custody .

“We have ample evidence to show that the main complainant’s video was made while she was still a minor. Hence, we consulted our legal team and decided to slap the Pocso charges against Loharuka,” sources said.

Public prosecutor Tamal Mukherjee said interrogation of the two was necessary as their medical tests would be carried out. He informed the court that several videos were still being recovered from the duo. The third accused, Kailash Yadav, a cook of Loharuka, will be produced in court on Friday.

However, defence lawyers argued that the accused had not circulated the video themselves. “He had taken the video with the complainant’s full consent when they were in a relationship. It was the other accused who used it for ulterior motives,” said a lawyer who appeared for Aggarwal.

Earlier, six women lodged complaints against the two while the police contacted with three of them. Two of the complainants who are married have told the police that they had been in a relationship with one of the two accused almost six years ago when both the victim and the accused were minors. One of the women said she had no clue about how the videos of her intimate moments were recorded by the accused.

Title: Goa budget: Pramod Sawant expects Rs 500 crore revenue from mining
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

The chief minister said resumption of mining and allied activities is the priority of the budget.

PANAJI: While listing the five steps taken by the state government to restart mining activities, chief minister Pramod Sawant, who is also the finance minister, projected Rs 500 crore revenue from the sector for the financial year 2020-2021 in the budget.

The chief minister said resumption of mining and allied activities is the priority of the budget. “Yes we have considered Rs 500 crore revenue from the mining sector. Definitely it will be more than that,” Sawant told reporters after presenting the budget.

Stating that the government has left no stone unturned to restart mining in the state, he said, in the interim, the Supreme Court decision to allow export and transportation of royalty paid iron ore extracted before March 15, 2018, has provided much relief to mining dependants.

He said the state government took five steps to restart mining, including filing of review petition against the Supreme Court’s February 7, 2018, order quashing second renewal of 88 mining leases, filing of interlocutory application for handling dumps, getting permission to allow exports for royalty paid ore, looking for alternative to resume mining and e-auctioning of iron ore.

“Restarting mining will help the government provide employment in the sector,” he said, adding that, precaution would be taken to protect the environment.

The state government will allow mining of major and minor minerals, including sand extraction, without violating environmental laws, he said.

Title: Officials begin preps after budget allocation for SCoR
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Representative image

VISAKHAPATNAM: With the announcement of budget allocations in the railway ministry’s pink book, it is clear that the ministry is keen on speeding up the works on the South Coast Railway ( SCoR ) zone .

With Visakhapatnam as the headquarters of SCoR, officials here are preparing to initiate works related to the zonal headquarters, like creation of office space, residential quarters for both officers and staff, welfare infrastructure such as hospitals and recreational facilities.

As per the detail project report (DPR) submitted by the officer on special duty earlier, at least Rs 111 crore would be required to develop the headquarters. “The ministry sanctioned Rs 170 crore for SCoR in the budget announced recently. The works would hopefully begin soon,” said a senior railway officer to TOI.

As per the norms for different grades of officers and staff as stipulated in the Railway Board’s letter number 5720, dated August 12, 1976, a general manager cadre officer must have office space of 60 square meters while lower-level cadre officers, like Group C, must have six meters of office space.

“The total office space needed to house 170 officers and 1,080 group C staff is 11,105 square meters. Since the existing divisional office has a plinth area of 11,536 square meters, there would be no big exercise involved in creating office space,” the railway officer said, while adding that the existing Waltair division office can readily be used to cater to the immediate requirements of the new zonal headquarters.

The expected staff and officer strength for the headquarters will be around 3,000. Since nearly 1,800 staff already works at the Waltair division, there would be no need to transfer incumbent staff to other places, except the junior staff depending on the requirement of the newly-formed Rayagada division or SCoR, the railway officials said.

Title: TNPSC scam: Key accused surrenders
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

S Jayakumar

CHENNAI: Prime suspect and brain behind the TNPSC examination scam surrendered before a Saidapet court on Thursday. The CB-CID, probing the alleged malpractice, had been hunting for S Jayakumar, 45, for the last two weeks even as investigators arrested 32 people in connection with scams in the 2019 Group IV exam and the 2017 Group II-A exam.

The 23rd metropolitan magistrate court directed that Jayakumar be remanded till Friday and be produced before the CB-CID court in Egmore on that day. CB-CID investigators are expected to take him into custody for detailed questioning. Police constable Sithandi and Jayakumar are the main suspects in the scam.

Police circulated his photographs at airports, major railway stations and bus terminals to prevent Jayakumar from escaping to another state or country. A week ago, police, who suspected Jayakumar’s role in both scams, conducted searches at his Mogappair house and seized a laptop, pen drive and more than 60 special ink pens apart from documents. Police also found that Sithandi, who was arrested from Sivaganga, had collected Rs 82.5 lakh from seven job aspirants who cleared the 2017 group II-A exam and were selected for government jobs then. Meanwhile, the CB-CID has taken accused Omkanthan into five days police custody in connection with the TNPSC Group IV exam scam. Omkanthan was assigned to assist TNPSC staff Manickavel in transporting the answer sheets from Rameswaram to Chennai. Around 8 pm on September 1, 2019, after loading the answer sheets in a van, Omkanthan kept the key with him. Jayakumar followed the van in another vehicle.

Meanwhile, with the detention of a VAO, recruited in 2016 through TNPSC exam, for suspected job fraud, the CB-CID suspect malpractices in the VAO test held then. The VAO allegedly gave Rs 15 lakh to Jayakumar to get selected. Five others, who were selected as VAOs after writing the exam in February 2016, are also under the scanner.

Title: Two cellphones, four batteries found in Kalamba Jail
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

KOLHAPUR: The security at Kalamba jail has again come under the scanner after two mobile phones and four batteries were recovered within the premises recently.

A surprise check by the officials of Kalamba Central Prison led to the recovery of the items that are not permitted in the jail premises. The security officials found the phones and the batteries buried under the ground near a latrine in circle number 9 of the jail premises. A case has been registered against the unidentified persons with the Juna Rajwada police station.

Jail superintendent Sharad Shelke took charge of the prison on Wednesday after returning from a training and issued orders to launch a search operation.

“We have issued instructions to the jail staff to check the CCTV footage and other sources to find out who are the owners of these mobile phones and how they managed to get these phones inside the jail premises,” said an official from Kalamba jail.

“We suspect that the prisoners get their hands on the phones from their relatives during their visits to the civil hospital for routine check-up. We have initiated a strict watch at the entrance gate of the jail and will ensure that such material does not enter into the jail premises,” he said.

Two months ago, when Shelke had gone for training, the jail officials found a mobile phone that had been abandoned in the premises. A case has been registered in this regard too with the Juna Rajwada police station.

The issue of security in and around Kalamba jail has surfaced several times in last few years. In November 2015, two jail superintendents from Kalamba Central prison were suspended after the video of merrymaking at the Kalamba jail went viral. The video showed five jail inmates cooking food, eating dry fruits and allegedly smoking marijuana in the jail.

In 2018, a clip was posted on social media that showed a prisoner holding a pistol made of cardboard in his barrack in Kalamba jail.

Title: Goa budget 2020: Education focus shifts to meet industry needs
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Representative image

PANAJI: Planning to give Goa a private universities act has shown that the state is now seriously considering changing its course to focus on a new kind of economy revolving around an education hub.

Besides this, chief minister Pramod Sawant made it clear in his budget on Thursday that he wants to also focus on closing the gap between education and industry requirement.

“We want to see what is the need at the industry level and what are the areas in which skills need to be imparted. With this in mind, we have decided to start industrial internship programmes. It will help us provide local students with good future and help them to get better employment,” the chief minister said.

With the same objective in mind, Goa College of Architecture will see the introduction of two masters programmes in the new and emerging areas of MArch Urban Design and MArch Sustainable Habitat from the academic year 2020-21.

The state is considering setting up centres to give students information about competitive exams and opportunities like UPSC, Sawant said.

The state has also formed a committee to bring about smooth transition from school education to higher education, the chief minister and education minister said, without explaining the purpose of such a committee.

“To improve the quality of education, we are trying to introduce innovative methods of teaching. We are encouraging a personal connect between teacher and student,” said the chief minister.

Title: Action against two private money lenders soon
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Representative image

KOLHAPUR: The co-operative department has asked the police department to register cases against two out of seven private moneylenders whose homes were raided last month in Panhala taluka . The two were found lending money without valid licences.

According to the police officials, the co-operative department had raided the homes of seven people from Kotoli village in Panhala taluka after it received complaints that alleged that they were operating as private money lenders .

Officials had seized several documents, including stamp papers, agreements and other material. The officials stated they have finished the scrutiny of documents seized from two of the seven persons and have issued instructions to the police to take action.

The raid followed several complaints from people who have alleged harassment from private money lenders in the region who charge high interest rates and often resort to illegal tactics to recover the money. Two months ago, homes of 16 private money lenders were raided by officials who also recovered Rs 25 lakh in cash from them.

As per the data available with the cooperative department, there are only 255 money lenders in the region who have valid licences to operate.

Kolhapur police have also registered cases against two private money lenders. One complaint was registered with the Ichalkaranji police station and other complaint is with the Jaysingpur police station.

The two lenders have been booked under several sections of the IPC and relevant sections of the Maharashtra Moneylending Act.

Superintendent of police Abhinav Deshmukh has urged citizens to register complaints if they have information on people operating as money lenders without a licence or if they charge high interest rates.

Title: West Bengal: A week before opening, last daylight check of East-West tracks
Content:
Representative image

KOLKATA: A week before the commissioning of the first phase of the East-West Metro , power connection to the third rail has been switched off so that the 5km stretch on the elevated viaduct could be inspected. East-West Metro’s first phase will be unveiled on February 13.Officials said this would be the last daylight inspection of the section. After that track inspections would be possible only at night, once the rakes are back in the stabling yard. “ Therefore, the daylight inspection is crucial. All kinds of issues can be detected best in daylight,” an official said.“The power connection to the third rail will be switched on again on Sunday. By then, inspection crew will check every inch of the tracks so that a seamless commissioning can take place next Thursday,” the official added.Early on Thursday, inspection teams walked along the viaduct from Sector V to Salt Lake Stadium to check for water leaks, switch gears, pathway, lighting, earthing, cables and all other parameters to ensure glitch-free services. This is the first time since the trials began on July 4, 2018, that the tracks will be without power for 36 hours at a stretch.This will also be the last time that the tracks will go without power for so many hours. “Since train services can’t be suspended for so long again, this is our last chance check every issue along the tracks,” an engineer said. The tracks inspection is being carried out by Metro Railway Kolkata personnel and not by Kolkata Metro Rail Corporation ( KMRC ). The Metro Railway personnel have been trained especially to perform inspection services. The inspectors include track walkers who are exmining the tracks on foot.Even though KMRC is implementing the Rs 8,575 crore East-West Metro project, Metro Railway Kolkata, that runs the north-south line, will be in charge of operations of Kolkata’s Line No. 2.Based on the recce, inspection documents will be prepared. Officials said a software is being used to log track defects, if any. There are high-tech equipment called track geometry vehicles to correct any issue.The last trial run before commissioning took place on Wednesday. East-West Metro’s Phase-1 operations has gone through multiple delays, thanks to which the commercial run starts 18 months after the first trials began in July, 2018.

Title: PACS: Opposition slams state govt
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Hyderabad: Telangana Kisan Congress on Thursday alleged that TRS is using muscle power to take over primary agriculture cooperative societies ( PACS ) . “In view of the elections, Rythu Bandhu for rabi is being distributed now,” Kisan Congress chairman Anvesh Reddy said in a statement. “This is nothing, but treating farmers as vote bank,” he added.

BJP leader Premendar Reddy also slammed the state government for trying to take control of PACS elections. Agriculture minister S Niranjan Reddy refuted the allegations. TNN

Title: Vizag taking steps to be a nutraceutical hub: Expert
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Speaking to TOI on the sidelines of a workshop, Amit Srivatava, CEO of Bio-Valley said he is confident that Visakhapatnam would soon emerge as a global hub in Nutriceuticals. The AMTZ ( Med Tech Zone ) in Visakhapatnam houses the Bio-Valley, where a number of start-ups are working on products which could help redefine the nutraceutical industry both in India and abroad. The products range from those tailor-made for India specific cancer patients to nano extracts and particles from Ayurvedic herbs.

Srivatava noted that over the last couple of years a few start-ups have done some original research in producing products and devices that would go a long way in the international market. In fact he said, “Some of these products are going to make waves in the international market.”

Elaborating on some of the key products developed here at Bio-Valley in Visakhapatnam, Srivatava said, “As of now there are three products that will be runaway products and will soon become global products. We have produced the world’s first Indian Gut specific nutrition product for cancer patients. This powder was developed by Asperer and it is already being tested by the British NHS ( National Health Services) so that it can be approved for all hospitals in the UK.” Srivastava expressed happiness that the Bio-Valley was making bold strides to help Vizag become a leader in nutraceuticals.

Title: Goa budget: Rs 50 crore for dams to tap Mhadei water
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Representative image

PANAJI: There will be no compromise when it comes to Goans’ legal right over the Mhadei , chief minister Pramod Sawant said in his budget speech on Thursday, adding that a Rs 50 crore financial provision has been made to tap Mhadei’s water for construction of dams, reservoirs and bandharas.

The previous day, Sawant had told the assembly that Karnataka had misinformed the Union government that Mhadei’s water flowing through Goa was going to waste.

“I want to repeat my statement that Mhadei is even more important than my mother. In the Mhadei issue, there will be no compromise when it comes to Goans’ legal right,” said Sawant.

“We have made a strong case for Goa in the Supreme Court as well,” he said.

Sawant said that for the construction of dams, reservoirs and bandharas in the Mhadei river basin, the government will also try to seek support under the Central government’s Jal Shakti Abhiyaan.

Title: Goa budget: With zilla polls in mind, more powers to local civic bodies
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Pramod Sawant

PANAJI: While chief minister Pramod Sawant presented a modest and no-frills budget on Thursday, the political connotations of the exercise was not lost on political observers.

Political analysts were quick to point out that Sawant, while attempting to woo zilla panchayat members, clearly with an eye on the elections to the second tier panchayat bodies to be held on March 15, has also tried to please municipal bodies elections to which are due later this year.

While proposing to empower ZPs in both districts, Sawant spoke about plans to “extend recommendatory powers to ZP members for carrying out certain priority works within their jurisdictions. Also, members will be mandatory special invitees to the village gram sabhas, the chief minister said.

Sawant has also attempted to keep his flock in good humour by promising major development projects. Mapusa MLA Joshua D’Souza, Pernem MLA Manohar Azgaokar and Sanguem independent MLA Prasad Gaonkar stand to gain a ‘Kala Bhavan’ each while the Kala mandir at Cortalim—represented BJP legislator Alina Saldanha— will be operational soon.

By proposing to introduce Dugdhgram scheme to promote dairy farming in Cuncolim and Canacona, both represented by neo-saffronite MLAs Clafacio Dias and Isidore Fernandes, apart from one in Sal in the chief minister’s home constituency, Sawant has done a balancing act.

Title: Coronavirus in Chennai: Private hospitals barred from treating patients with coronavirus symptoms
Content:
Representative image

CHENNAI: Treatment for novel coronavirus will be done only at government hospitals and no private hospital should admit or treat patients with symptoms of the disease, the state health department told doctors’ bodies and private hospitals at a consultation meeting on Thursday.“All passengers coming from China have been put on home quarantine for 28 days. Our staff are in touch with them over phone. They have been told to contact health inspectors or village health nurses if they have symptoms of fever, sore throat, cold or breathing difficulty. If they call private hospitals, doctors there should direct them to government hospitals. If they land at their hospitals, we should be notified so we can pick them,” said Dr P Sampath, public health joint director of public health (epidemic control), after the meeting.The intention is to ensure the virus does not spread within the community. “We don’t have much information about the virus now. We don’t want any risk of suspected cases being exposed to the general public. At least four private hospitals said they have exclusive quarantine facilities, but we denied them permission,” he said. Public hospitals in the state have kept more than 250 beds ready for passengers who have to be quarantined. “The testing facility is now available only with King Institute. Facilities for testing patients are also available only at government hospitals,” he said.On Wednesday, Director of public health Dr K Kolanda Swamy said the state did not restrict private hospitals from treating patients with symptoms. However, during the stakeholders’ meeting officials made a U-turn on Thursday. Nevertheless, officials shared information about the virus and the protocol of the Centre and state.Meanwhile, health secretary Beela Rajesh said Tamil Nadu is encouraging Chinese nationals who have come to India after the outbreak of coronavirus to leave the country as early as possible. “Two Chinese nationals are currently admitted to government hospitals along with nine others,” she said. A student from China has been admitted in an isolation ward at the Asaripallam Government Medical College and Hospital in Kanyakumari district since Wednesday morning. Hospital authorities said she did not have any symptoms of the infection. “We are asking them to go back as early as possible,” Beela Rajesh said.

Title: Coronavirus in Kolkata: Kolkata airport starts tracking coronavirus victims’ co-flyers
Content: Those who flew with the three novel coronavirus victims will be tracked down by health officials and screen... Read More KOLKATA: Health officials at the airport are now trying to trace the co-passengers of the three confirmed victims of the virus in India who had travelled via Kolkata. The details of all the co-passengers will be handed over to the respective state government authorities.The primary job of the health officials is to put passengers arriving from China, Hong Kong, Singapore and Thailand through thermal screening to detect symptoms of novel coronavirus (nCoV).
