Rejecting the pleas, the first bench of Chief Justice AP Sahi and Justice Subramonium Prasad said, “We may clarify that the issue of reservation cannot be mixed up with the question of relaxation of age, in as much as reservation is provided in terms of Article 16 of the Constitution to enable the fulfillment of the constitutional goal of equitable representation of the oppressed classes.”

Whereas, relaxation of age is an act or exercise of authority that renders a rule or some form of control or prescription, less strict or severe. It is an act that brings about some sort of partial remission by lessening the stiffness or intensity by bending it to a certain extent, the bench added.

Noting that the former (reservation), is in terms of the Constitution, the bench said, “The latter (relaxation) is a prescription of statutory procedure to meet a certain exigency at the option of the authority to exercise such power. The power to relax is not a fundamental right of reservation to be enforced under the Constitution. It is in cases of hostile discrimination or manifest arbitrariness that a challenge be raised upon exercise of such power. Reservation and relaxation have therefore to be understood as two separate concepts and hence, relaxation is not a synonym for reservation.”

The issue pertains to a notification issued by the Tamil Nadu government dated December 12, 2019, fixing upper age limit for aspiring candidates from OBC category as 45 years. TNN

Title: Teachers call for lenient promotion system
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Representative image

COIMBATORE: Teachers in higher education institutions have reiterated their demand for a lenient academic performance indicator (API) system for giving promotions through career advancement scheme.

API system was made mandatory for promotions and other benefits for faculty members of higher education institutions in 2010. It has a universal set of criteria for awarding scores that do not distinguish between teaching and research institutions or between rural and urban institutions, the teachers said.

“As per API requirements, we should publish research papers and conduct seminars. It is more suited for those, who are into full-time research and not into teaching. If teaching faculty focusses on research and publications, they would not have enough time for classwork,” a teacher said.

Teachers said there has to be distinction between purely teaching institutions, purely research institutions and those, which have a mix of both, and the API criteria should be framed based on that.

President of the Association of University Teachers (AUT) N Pasupathy said they have been representing the issue for long. “The API system doesn’t distinguish between rural institutions and urban institutions. It is difficult for faculty members in rural colleges to conduct national seminars. How would they meet the API criteria? It is unfair to have the same yardstick for rural and urban institutions,” he said. “Faculty members of teaching institutions would be unable to focus entirely on research and publication as they have pedagogical activities as well.”

While they were ready to conduct research and publish papers, it should not be forced on them for the sake of promotions and college rankings or it would lead to proliferation of bogus publications and paid journals, the teachers said. “We don’t oppose the system. We want it to be more sensitive towards the practicalities,” said Pasupathy.

While teachers have to rise to the occasion and do research and publications, making them mandatory, linking them with promotions, NAAC accreditation and NIRF rankings would bring down the quality of research and give rise to predatory publishing, said former general secretary of AUT C Pichandy.

The association had recently urged the University Grants Commission and the ministry of human resource development to withdraw the system.

Title: ‘Lack of manpower, infrastructure proving a challenge to palliative care in India’
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

The facility has 47 beds out of which 45 are occupied

MADURAI: Providing palliative care is challenging due to lack of infrastructure and manpower, said Madurai district collector T G Vinay on Thursday. Palliative care and geriatric medicine are the need of the hour since life expectancy of people has increased due to advancement in medical care, but absence of the facility puts medical community in a difficulty position, he added. Vinay took part in the 5th anniversary celebrations of Aishwaryam Trust, which runs Nethravathi palliative care centre for elderly people from poor background and abandoned on roadside at Vilachery. The collector appreciated the team of doctors with social consciousness for starting the trust. At a time when people have become self-centric, to think beyond oneself and contribute to the society has to be appreciated, he said. Vinay said he is ready to help them with infrastructure, manpower and financial support on behalf of the district administration. There are more such people needed to the society to make the place better, he added. A group of seven doctors came forward to start the facility after realizing the pain borne by terminally-ill people from poor background in the absence of any facility for them. They first started a facility in a rented building, later shifted to a permanent building. At present, the facility has 47 beds out of which 45 are occupied. Dr R Balagurusamy, chairman and managing trustee said that it costs around Rs 400 for one person per day and they find it challenging to run the hospice.

Title: Stolen mobile phones handed over to owners
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Representative image

MADURAI: The Madurai district Police Cyber Club has recovered 35 missing stolen mobile phones worth Rs 4.79 lakh in recent months. The phones were handed over to the respective owners on Thursday by the district superintendent of police N Manivannan.

Similarly, Rs 5.6 lakh money stolen from bank accounts in the guise of bank managers over the phone, were also restored.

The district police have urged public not to share one-time password received by them on their phones to anyone. Once, the information is shared, scamsters get access to the money available in their accounts.

According to the district police, 188 phones have been recovered so far in the last couple of years by the cyber club.

Title: Court reserves judgment on hiking reservation limit
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Representative image

VIJAYAWADA: The high court reserved the judgment on a petition seeking the cancellation of government order 176 confirming the reservations for local body elections. The high court bench headed by Chief Justice JK Maheswari heard the petition on Thursday and reserved the judgment.

The petitioners argued that the state government ignored the directions of the Supreme court and issued the GO exceeding the 50% reservations in local body elections. They argued that no socio-economic survey was conducted to gauge the BC population in the state. They questioned the government to explain the reasons for fixing 34% reservation for BCs in local body elections.

Arguing on behalf of the government, advocate general Sri Ram said the door-to-door electoral survey conducted by the government clarified that the population of BCs in Andhra Pradesh is around 48%. He said the government is giving lesser reservations when compared to the population of BC’s in the state. He reminded that the SC in some extreme cases exempted the state government from exceeding reservations more than 50%.

Sriram pointed out that the state government will lose around Rs 3,000 crore central funds, if the local body elections are delayed. He requested the court to give permissions to conduct the elections immediately.

The court after examining the arguments reserved the judgment.

Title: Sugarcane farmers urge government to reopen closed mill in Srikakulam district
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Picture used for representational purpose

SRIKAKULAM: While Srikakulam district produces between 65,000 to 70,000 kg of total sugar production in the country, sugarcane farmers have to rely on one mill at Sankili in Rajam mandal in the district. Farmers have demanded that the government revive the closed sugarcane mill at Amadalavalasa.

Speaking to TOI, minister of roads and buildings Dharmana Krishnadas said though the government is focusing on fulfilling its poll promises, it will revive the sugarcane mill at Amadalavalasa.

Sugarcane farmers in the district have to depend on the mill at Sankili, said a spokesperson at the mill. Nearly 98 per cent of the sugarcane harvested is brought to this unit for crushing and extraction of sugar, while two per cent makes its way to local jaggery manufacturing units.

“We spend nearly Rs 3,600 to produce one quintal of sugar but sell at Rs 3,200 per quintal. The industry is running at a loss,” the spokesperson said, attributing fall in prices to the low priority given to sugarcane cultivation and the industry.

“The sugar industry is owned by the Centre, which collects taxes of Rs 475 under various heads, but does not pay attention to cultivaton, production or minimum support price (MSP) to farmers,” said K Sanyasinaidu , a sugarcane farmer from Rajam.

P Simhachalam, a sugarcane farmer from Sankili said, “Srikakulam district has abundant land to cultivate sugarcane, but farmers now are not happy with the way the government is handling the industry. Most farmers are instead turning to the cultivation of maize given its low investment and high returns.”

Close to 10,000 sugarcane farmers cultivate the crop on around 15,000 acres in the district. The average sugar production per annum in India ranges between 35 million tonnes to 40 million tonnes.

Title: Awareness session on recycling of e-waste held in Dindigul
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Representative image

MADURAI: A training and awareness session on e-waste management for manufacturers and dealers of electronic goods was held in Dindigul district on Thursday.

The programme was conducted by the Tamil Nadu Pollution Control Board (TNPCB), department of school education and Dindigul district administration. Speaking at the event, the Dindigul district collector M Vijayalakshmi said that the Ministry for environment, forests and climate change has issued rules, which came into effect from October 1, 2016, for handling and discarding of e-waste.

E-wastes include computers, laptops, printers, telephones, cellphones, televisions, washing machines and air conditioners. According to the rules, the manufacturers of the above mentioned gadgets are liable for an extended producers’ responsibility to ensure that their products are channelized to the authorized dismantler or recycler after the end-life of the gadget, she said.

Title: Naturalist, green teacher passes away in Kolkata
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Kushal Mookherjee

KOLKATA: One of the pioneers of nature conservation in eastern region, Kushal Mookherjee , passed away in Kolkata on Thursday. He was 63. Mookherjee is survived by wife Diti and son Promit. Mookherjee, who was suffering from liver ailment, died at his Tollygunge home.

Remembering Mukherjee, who had started the concept of bird watching and bird survey in the region, conservationist Sujan Chatterjee said: “He was a great teacher, who formed Prakriti Samsad in 1978. Apart from leading conservation efforts in the field, he also fired the zeal of conservation among others. I am also one of his students.”

Recalling his association with Mookherjee, veteran conservationist Colonel Shakti Ranjan Banrjee said how Mookherjee and his team busted the myth of bird suicide in Assam’s Jatinga. “It was around 1980 when I first met him. He was a member of a WWF team that was being led by Purnima Dutta, the then project coordinator of the NGO,” he said. Mookherjee also played a major role in the formation of Chintamani Kar bird sanctuary at Narendrapur .

Title: Call to regularise land records
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Visakhapatnam: The Vizianagaram district administration has issued a notice urging the public to regularise their land sale purchase-deeds and get them registered with the government.

With this regard, the state government had passed GO MS NO23 Revenue (Lands-1) on January 1. It has now been extended May 31.

As per the notice, people will have to get their records ( record of rights) regularised by sending a petition filed under Form-X to the concerned tahsildar, who will review the petition. Sources in the district administration revealed that there are many such cases within the district where purchasers have not bothered to get their names included in the RoR that has resulted in a lot of confusion. tnn

Title: Iridium scam: 3 men arrested for duping goat trader of Rs 5 lakh
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Representative image

COIMBATORE: The rural police on Wednesday arrested three men, including a DMK functionary, for cheating a goat trader of Rs 5 lakh by offering to sell a temple kalasam (dome).

Police identified them as DMK functionary S Arumugam, 38 and K Raja, 43, of Kumarasamy Nagar in Tirupur and P Dhanabal, 33, of Somanur. “Dhanabal had told his friend P Saminathan, 50, of Moolanur in Tirupur, a goat trader, that he was in possession of a temple kalasam made of iridium, which had magical properties that would make him prosperous and popular. Those who own the kalasam won’t be affected by diseases, Dhanabal told him and offered to sell it for Rs 25 lakh,” a police office said.

Saminathan decided to buy the object and gave Rs 5 lakh as advance to the trio a week ago. “On Wednesday, the trio asked Saminathan to meet them at Samychettipalayam Road near Periyanaickenpalayam. They came there in a car and showed him a metallic object. They offered to hand it over to him if he gives them the rest of the amount. However, Saminathan grew suspicious and informed the Periyanaickenpalayam police. A police team rushed to the spot and arrested the trio,” the officer added.

Police seized the car, the object and Rs 90,000 from the trio. They were booked under sections 406 (criminal breach of trust) and 420 (cheating) of the Indian Penal Code, remanded in judicial custody and lodged in the Coimbatore Central Prison.

Title: VOC Port handles 55,020 metric tonne coal in a day
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

MADURAI: The V O Chidambaranar (VOC) Port Trust in Tuticorin has created a new record by discharging 55,020 metric tonne of coal in 24 hours on Tuesday. This has surpassed the previous record of 54,512 metric tonne of coal from the vessel M V Pacific Victory on December 11, 2018, that was set 13 months ago by 508 metric tonne.

On Monday, the Liberian flagged vessel M V Agio Sostis with an overall length of 225m, beam of 32.26m and draft of 14.02m was berthed at the VOC Port . The gearless vessel carrying 71,500 tonne of coal consigned to Global Coal Ventures started discharging coal through the harbour mobile cranes operated by M/s Imcola Crane Company Private Limited.

In 24 hours, a total of 55,050 metric tonne discharge was completed. M/s Seaport Shipping Private Limited is the vessel agent and M/s Sea Port Logistics Private Limited is the stevedore agent.

Chairman of the port trust T K Ramachandran stated that this financial year (till February 4) the port has handled 30.22 million tonne of cargo and 6.74 lakh TEUs of containers – which is an increase of 4.45% and 8.28%, respectively, compared to the corresponding period in the previous financial year.

Title: Lift restriction on import of peas, Tamil Nadu CM writes to Centre
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Due to heavy demand of peas in other states, cost of peas transported from the northern states becomes very... Read More CHENNAI: Chief minister Edappadi K Palaniswami on Thursday urged the Centre to lift the restriction on import of peas through Tuticorin port for the welfare of the dal and flour milling trade in the state as well as neighbouring southern states. In a letter to Union commerce and industry minister Piyush Goyal, the chief minister recalled a public notification issued by the director general of foreign trade imposing a restriction on the import of peas to 1.5 lakh metric tonne for the entire country. “Due to this restriction, the cost of peas has drastically increased to more than Rs 65 per kg in Tamil Nadu. This ban has detrimentally affected the dal and flour mills operating as MSME units in Tamil Nadu and thereby the livelihood of labourers and others who depend on this trade,” Palaniswami said. Due to heavy demand for peas to prepare traditional snacks in Tamil Nadu, Puducherry and Kerala, more than 1,000 micro , small, and medium dal and flour mills function in Tamil Nadu for processing the peas. They provide direct employment opportunity to around 50,000 labourers and indirect employment to 65,000 people. “The average requirement of peas in Tamil Nadu would be around two lakh metric tonnes, of which maximum of 10,000MT alone are being transported from the northern states,” the chief minister said. Due to heavy demand of peas in other states, cost of peas transported from the northern states becomes very high and ranges up to Rs 60/kg. Hence, peas are imported from countries such as Australia, Canada and Russia through Tuticorin port at cheaper rates. Peas are cultivated in an area of 5.40 lakh hectares in the country. The annual estimated production is 54.22 lakh metric tonnes. In Tamil Nadu, green peas are cultivated in 120 hectares and the production is 1,960MT.

Title: Unscheduled power cuts cause trouble to residents in Madurai
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

School students struggle a lot due to power cuts in the morning as the many school buildings are located in co... Read More

MADURAI: Unscheduled power cuts have started affecting the residents in many parts of the city. Power has been going off in the mornings and afternoons for two to three hours on a daily basis, lament residents.

Melamadai, Anna Nagar and Gomathypuram areas had a power cut from 3pm to 6pm on Monday and the local electricity offices had calls from residents eager to know why the power had gone off. “Power shutdowns in the afternoons are causing inconvenience to the elders and children,” said K Chandran of Anna Nagar.

School students struggle a lot due to power cuts in the morning as the many school buildings are located in congested spots. “Many of these schools don’t have playground facilities and the children are forced to spend the whole day within the building in Anna Nagar, Gomathypuram and Melamadai and when the power goes off, the children really suffer and the education department should take note of this,” said Gomathy S of K K Nagar.

Othakadai, Villapuram, Anupandi, DRO Colony and Viswanathapuram are among the places that have been experiencing these frequent power cuts for the past few days. This condition prevails even after a full day shutdown is scheduled within the next few days.

Inverter dealers said that they have already started receiving prospective calls something that usually happens from March onwards and added that the demand is going up due to the rising afternoon temperatures and frequent power cuts.

TNEB sources said that they were not planning such shutdowns due to any shortfall, but it may be required due to some issues being detected in the respective sub stations. “Common problems like glows in the transformers are detected in summer and there were a few such cases recently and they needed attention,” sources said.

Title: Education secretary among IAS officers transferred
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Representative image

CHENNAI: Days after rolling back the plan for public examinations for Classes V and VIII, the government on Thursday made school education secretary Pradeep Yadav secretary of handlooms, textiles and khadi department. Dheeraj Kumar will now helm the school education department, besides youth welfare and sports development.

Recently, after an official session of the cabinet, several ministers opposed public examinations for young students, fearing backlash in the impending civic elections. Incidentally, the department issued the contentious order in September, without a cabinet nod, relying on the amendments to Right to Education Act. “Yadav himself opted to move out,” said a source.

The department introduced large-scale reforms, including restructuring cluster-based models in government schools and merging posts of district educational officers , inspector of matriculation schools and district elementary education officer posts, drawing the ire of the teaching fraternity. In January, students of Classes IX to XII were told to come to schools on January 16, during the Pongal holidays, to listen to Narendra Modi’s ‘Pariksha Pe Charcha’. Later, after the opposition hit out, the government said it was only an advisory and not a ‘circular’.

On Thursday, transport secretary B Chandra Mohan was named secretary, department of BCs, MBCs and minorities welfare. The post was additionally held by highways secretary A Karthik, who will now also helm energy department. Overseas Manpower Corporation Limited chairman and MD Dharmendra Pratap Yadav is the new transport secretary, while handlooms, textiles and khadi secretary Kumar Jayant will head the Overseas Manpower Corporation Limited as its chairman and MD, the order said.

Title: Court to hear Centre’s argument on colouring offices in party colours
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Vijayawada: The high court on Thursday heard the petition filed against YSRC for painting government offices in party colours and Chief Justice JK Maheswari said “I have gone through media clips where the Telangana chief minister K Chandrasekhar Rao directed officials of TSRTC not to print his photographs on buses. I hope AP chief minister YS Jaganmohan Reddy will direct officials not to print his photos on village secretariats and panchayat offices.”

The court has decided to hear the arguments of the Union government on painting government offices in party colours as the state election commission has said that it is not in their preview. It then posted the matter for further hearing on February 11.

The court had earlier directed the state government to file affidavits along with the details of YSRC party symbols and colors printed on the panchayat offices. tnn

Title: Event on kids’ diet
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Visakhapatnam: To address malnutrition issues, the organisation Junior Chambers International – Visakha Valley is initiating a nutrition-related awareness programme for public. To begin with, the programme will begin on Friday at the GVMC High School at Dandubazar. It is called Project Hope (Health Orientation Programme for Everyone). The first session would be for GVMC school children in the age group of 8-12 years by trainer and health couselor Sangeeta Muddapu. tnn

Title: Madurai: Three workers killed after truck runs over them
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Representative image

MADURAI: Three workers, who were sleeping at a construction site, were killed when a concrete mixer truck ran over them. The accident took place early on Thursday morning, when the truck driver moved the vehicle in reverse direction without noticing the sleeping workers.

The deceased were identified as S Venkatesh, 30, S Periyasamy, 34, both from Attur in Salem district and A Babu, 38, from Koyambedu in Chennai. While Venkatesh and Periyasamy were killed on the spot, Babu was rushed to the Government Rajaji Hospital, where he died without responding to treatment.

The accident took place on the Vaigai river bank near Obula Padithurai, where the Vaigai River Front Development work, a project under Smart City Mission, executed by the Madurai Corporation, is taking shape.

Police sources said the workers slept in the open place on Wednesday night.

A corporation official said that they were engaged by the contractor, to whom the smart city work was allotted. The truck involved in the accident belongs to a sub-contractor.

“The deaths were purely due to negligence of the workers and the truck driver. Madurai Corporation has allotted place for them to stay, where temporary sheds have been erected. Many of the workers stay with their family members in the sheds. Had they slept in the allotted space, the incident would not have happened,” the official said.

The driver, identified as Arockiyasamy has been picked for inquiry. The Madhiciyam police registered a case.

Title: Coronavirus scare: Cleaning stepped up in public places
Content:
City corporation started cleaning public places with disinfectants on Thursday

COIMBATORE: In an effort to check the risk of infection from coronavirus (2019-nCoV), the city corporation started cleaning public places with disinfectants on Thursday.The state government had sent a circular to the deputy director of health services directing to step up disinfection activities in all hospitals and public places on Wednesday. The circular also directed the officials to provide necessary technical guidance to both government and private institutions to organize disinfection activities on a regular basis.Based on the directions, the corporation deployed sanitary workers to clean the floor, escalators, handrails and benches in public places including bus stands, railway stations and state-run buses that are frequently touched by the public.

Title: Why Viveka case not given to CBI, asks HC
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Vijayawada: The high court , on Thursday, heard petitions filed seeking a CBI probe into the death of former minister YS Vivekananda Reddy. The court the government to file an affidavit explaining reasons for not giving the case to the CBI. To which, the additional advocate general sought time to file an affidavit. The court posted the case to February 13.

Vivekananda Reddy’s daughter Sunitha Narreddy had earlier filed a petition in the High Court expressing his doubts over the SIT inquiry and said that she was dissatisfied with chief minister YS Jaganmohan Reddy, who had earlier sought an CBI inquiry and later the AP government had filed an affidavit in the court that CBI inquiry is not necessary.YS Vivekananda Reddy’s wife Soubhagyamma, MLC Btech Ravi, former minister Adinarayana Reddy also moved the high court seeking CBI inquiry into Vivekananda Reddy’s murder. tnn

Title: Multi-level car parking lot to be built at Coimbatore airport
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

The current car parking capacity at the airport is 270

COIMBATORE: Authorities are planning to construct a multi-level car parking lot near the cargo shed of the airport .

“The place chosen for the parking lot has staff quarters. We plan to remove the quarters and clear the space soon,” airport director R Mahalingam told TOI. “We have appointed a design consultant to do a detailed assessment of the location, feasibility and probable structural designs.”

The current car parking capacity at the airport is 270, the official said. “We plan to multiply it. The parking lot will be developed on a build–operate–transfer basis. The number of vehicles will be decided by the consultant, who will study the projected growth in traffic,” said the director.

With the air passenger traffic increasing between 15% to 20% every year, reaching up to 30 lakh in the last financial year, officials believe that increasing parking facilities is crucial. “We want to increase the size of the terminal buildings and runways as we are getting more business, passengers and traffic. Parking for passengers is a crucial infrastructure in any top airport. It must be expanded. The airport plans to create adequate infrastructure for passengers to park their cars when they board an aircraft and pick them up after they land, which is common abroad. So, there should be a facility to park cars even for a month,” said an official.

Title: Police launch drive against air horns
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Representative image

Police launch drive against air horns: The city traffic police on Thursday registered cases against 90 heavy vehicles including buses and trucks for using air horns after conducting checks on Avinashi Road, Trichy Road, Sathy Road, Mettupalayam Road and Pollachi Road.

Police also seized 21 motorcycles fitted with LED lights.

Title: Andhra Pradesh: Bus driver held for rape bid on student
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Representative image

Title: Madras HC orders notice on anticipatory bail plea
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Madras high court

CHENNAI: The Madras high court on Thursday ordered notice to CB-CID on an anticipatory bail application moved by a secretariat staff fearing arrest in connection with Tamil Nadu Public Services Commission ( TNPSC ) exam scams .

Admitting her plea, Justice M Dhandapan directed CB-CID to file its response by February 13.

D Kavitha said she is an assistant in the department of finance at the secretariat. She apprehended arrest in connection with the scam, as her three other batchmates have been arrested. Claiming to be on maternity leave, Kavitha submitted that only on January 23 she gave birth to a boy.

She further said she got appointed in government service after clearing the TNPSC Group II examination in 2017-18 in which she secured 48th rank overall and came sixth in communal ranking.

Her batchmate M Vignesh had written the examination at the same centre and secured 46th rank.

However, he was recently arrested by CB-CID for having allegedly paid money to clear the exam. Assuring she won’t tamper with any evidence, Kavitha pleaded the court to grant her bail in case of arrest.

Title: Coimbatore corporation demolishes 5 temples
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Corporation demolished five temples at Jeeva Nagar near Kavundampalayam on Thursday

COIMBATORE: The city corporation demolished five temples on the Link Road at Jeeva Nagar near Kavundampalayam on Thursday based on the directions of the Madras high court.

“After a long battle, the corporation had demolished the houses that were encroaching on the road a few months ago. But it did not clear the temples and some other private encroachments on the road. The building had to be removed to lay road. So, we sought the intervention of the court,” said Sumathi, president of the KK Pudur Women’s Association, who had filed a public interest litigation (PIL) a couple of months ago.

When the case came up for hearing on January 28, the court directed the civic body to remove the encroachments and lay the road before February 18. A corporation official said that officials of the town planning wing surveyed the land to identify the extent of encroachments and removed five temples. “We have prepared estimate to lay the road and fund has also been allotted,” he said.

The KK Pudur Welfare Association had filed a writ petition in HC a decade ago stating that the 70-feet Link Road was encroached. As a result, emergency service vehicles including ambulances and water tenders could enter the street. The court had passed directions in favour of the association in 2017.

Title: ‘FIR against Kishore without any evidence’
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Vijayawada: The HC on Thursday maintained status quo on the FIR filed by AP CID against IRS officer Krishna Kishore . It posted the case for further hearing on February 27. Neeraj Malhotra, Kishore’s counsel, argued that the CID had filed a case against Kishore without proper evidence and urged the court to quash the FIR. He said the case was filed intentionally to trouble Kishore, who had earlier worked as a supervising officer in the I-T department and played an active role in the investigation of YS Jaganmohan Reddy’s Jagati publications case. tnn

Title: Bengaluru: ‘Buyer’ escapes with student’s Rs 2.3 lakh sports bike
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Representative image

BENGALURU: Police are searching for a miscreant who sped away with a sports bike worth Rs 2.3 lakh from a student on the pretext of taking it for a test drive.

The 21-year-old student from Jayanagar 4th Block had posted on an online advertisement portal that he wanted to sell his bike.

The businessman’s son was approached by a prospective buyer, who identified himself as Sagar, and asked the student to meet him near a hotel in JP Nagar III Phase.

Accordingly, the duo met at 2.40pm on January 31. Sagar asked the student for the bike key, saying he would take it for a spin. Before the boy could react, Sagar sped away on the sportsbike and never returned.

“We have registered a case of theft and cheating against Sagar, based on the student’s complaint. Efforts are on to nab him,” a JP Nagar police officer said.

Title: Police stations in west zone to vie for ISO tag
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Representative image

COIMBATORE: West zone inspector general of police K Periaiah has instructed the superintendents of police (SPs) in his jurisdiction to select police stations in their respective districts to develop necessary infrastructures that are required to bag ISO certification.

Periaiah said the SPs in Coimbatore, Nilgiris, Tirupur, Erode, Salem, Namakkal, Dharmapuri and Krishnagiri districts have been advised to focus on developing at least four police stations in their respective districts. “Most of the police stations in the west zone are having good ambiance. We have to now develop the infrastructure. Cops have also been advised to maintain friendly relations with the general public.” said Periaiah.

The move is inspired by Thondamuthur police station in the district bagging the ISO certification. The M-2 Thondamuthur police station has been certified ISO 9001:2015 for maintaining law and order, prevention and detection of crimes, creating awareness among public and maintaining friendly relation with the public with available resources for making strong social policing.

According to circle inspector G Manivannan said there is a herbal garden in front of the station. “As per the government order, the station should have 32 police personnel. But it has only 12 cops. Thondamuthur is the first police station to obtain the ISO certification in the western Tamil Nadu.

District SP Sujit Kumar, meanwhile, said other police inspectors have also expressed their interest to upgrade the infrastructure at their police stations to get the ISO certification.

Title: Kamal Nath govt forms agriculture council for kisan welfare
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

BHOPAL: Nine years after Shivraj Singh Chouhan-led BJP government formed a special agriculture cabinet to resolve farmers’ issues, a little over a year after coming to power, the Congress government in Madhya Pradesh has come up with the idea of an agriculture advisory council (ADC).

It will be headed by the chief minister and the agriculture minister has been named as its vice-chairman. With a five-year term, the council will implement the recommendations of the farmers’ organisations and their representatives.

Interestingly, one of the members of the committee is also farmer leader Shivkumar Sharma alias Kakkaji, the president of Kisan Mazdoor Sangh, who is known for spearheading big farmers’ agitations across the state. Welcoming the move, he said that farmers would benefit if the government implements his recommendations in the right earnest.

Besides monitoring the ongoing loan waiver scheme of the Congress government, the ADC will also get feedback for the prices of agriculture produce and “work in the direction of making agriculture a profitable venture.”

Government sources said CM Kamal Nath wanted an organisation to closely monitor farmers’ issues along with the monitoring of various schemes, including the loan waiving scheme.

Besides the agriculture department secretary as member secretary of the council, there will be 20 members, including top government bureaucrats and the vice- chancellor of Rajmata Vijayaraje Scindia Krishi Vishwa Vidyalaya, Gwalior . There will be 7 non-government members, including Dinesh Gurjar from Morena, Shivkumar Sharma from Hoshangabad,Umrao Singh Gurjar from Neemuch, Kedar Sirohi from Harda, Vishwanath Okte from Chhindwara and Tarachand Patidar and Brijbihari Patel from Jabalpur .

The council will give suggestions and recommendations to the state government on the basis of feedback from the farmers. Its responsibilities also include reviewing the implementation of Centre-aided and state-aided schemes, besides extending their benefits to farmers and making recommendations after receiving suggestions. The council will take feedback and give suggestions in connection to crop prices, availability of seeds and facilities in mandis.

Title: Guntur medical college gets MCI nod to increase DM seats
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Guntur medical college

Guntur: The Medical Council of India (MCI) has granted permission to increase the number of super specialisation seats in neurology at Guntur medical college to four, making it the only college in the state to have four DM (doctorate of medicine) seats. Nizam’s Institute of Medical Sciences (NIMS) in Hyderabad has eight seats in DM stream, the highest in the two Telugu states.

The MCI board of governors, at its meeting held in New Delhi recently, gave the nod to increase the intake in DM neurology from the earlier two to four, after studying the report submitted by a expert panel which stated that the existing infrastructure in the department of neurology at GMC is on a par with other central deemed medical universities across the country.

The neurology wing at the medical college has undergone a complete revamp in the last few years under the leadership of department head Dr N V Sundarachary. Many philanthropists have come forward to help develop it further after seeing the services offered by the team of neurologists headed by Dr Sundarachary. Natco pharma sponsored the development of sleep lab at the hospital, the first such facility in government institutions in south India.

The neurology department is one of the few wings at the government general hospital (GGH) to receive the highest number of patients from across the two Telugu states, thanks to the services it offers to the poor. “More seats mean the state is going to get more super specialists to serve the people. We are happy to make the department a centre of excellence,” said Dr Sundarachary.

Title: Senthil Balaji: CCB sleuths search Senthil Balaji’s Mandaveli residence
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Representative image

CHENNAI: Central Crime Branch ( CCB ) sleuths on Thursday carried out a search at the Mandaveli residence of DMK district secretary Senthil Balaji . The search by a five-member team led by assistant commissioner Ramachandramoorthy was underway till late in the evening.

Though the house was sealed on January 31 as it was found locked, the seal was removed for the search which began at 10 am. While the Madras high court refused to intervene on the search notice issued by CCB, Senthil Balaji’s advocates accompanied the police team as earlier police had said in the notice that either Balaji or his authorised representative can be present during the search procedure. They stayed throughout the raid. CCB began reinvestigating the case of alleged job fraud by Senthil Balaji on January 31 and carried out searches in 17 places in the city, Karur and Madurai.

The issue pertains to a complaint against Balaji, now a DMK MLA, with CCB alleging that when he was the transport minister in the AIADMK government, he along with his associates had duped job-seekers to the tune of Rs 2.31 crore after promising jobs in the state transport corporation. Apprehending arrest in the case, Balaji moved an anticipatory bail application. Admitting it and as an interim relief, Madras HC judge Justice Audikesavalu orally instructed the CCB not to harass him.

Title: Finance Commission increases disaster relief share for Uttarakhand
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Chief minister Trivendra Singh Rawat

DEHRADUN: Chief minister Trivendra Singh Rawat on Thursday met the chairman of 15th finance commission, N K Singh in New Delhi and thanked him for the recommendations made by the body by “keeping in mind the tough conditions of the Himalayan state and its vulnerability to natural disasters”.

“The finance commission has considered this aspect of the state and increased the share of disaster relief fund to Rs 1,041 crore. It will certainly improve the state’s disaster management,” he added.The CM further said the state would immensely benefit from the revenue deficit grant and it will help in the financial management of Uttarakhand , as several crores of rupees are lost each year due to natural disasters.

The CM said Uttarakhand provides valuable environmental services, but the state has to face forest-related obstacles in the developmental works.

“There was a demand for a long time that states like Uttarakhand, which contributes to environmental protection, should be encouraged. The finance commission has increased the share of forests in the devolution formula from 7.5 % to 10 %, thereby increasing the share of revenue in the state,” Rawat said.

There has also been an increase of Rs 148 crore in the grants of urban local bodies and panchayati raj institutions of Uttarakhand, the CM said.

Title: Discuss issues with Andhra Pradesh CM YS Jaganmohan Reddy: Alla Ramakrishna Reddy to farmers
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Alla Ramakrishna Reddy

AMARAVATI: Mangalagiri legislator Alla Ramakrishna Reddy has appealed to agitating farmers of Amaravati to meet chief minister YS Jaganmohan Reddy to resolve their grievances . Cautioning them against falling prey to TDP chief N Chandrababu Naidu’s designs, Alla told the farmers that the Union government has already made it clear that it would not interfere in the capital city issue, and urged them to resolve their problems by discussing with the state government.

Speaking to reporters on Thursday, Alla said Naidu, who served as chief minister of the state for 14 long years, is now behaving like a village-level leader. “Amaravati farmers have never supported Naidu, who grabbed their lands in the capital city region people in the name of land pooling scheme (LPS). Now, he is using them for his selfish means. What has Naidu done for farmers after taking away their lands? I am ready to quit if Naidu or his son (Nara) Lokesh show any developed plot allotted to LPS farmers in Amaravati,” Alla alleged.

He also wondered why a capital city requires 1.6 lakh acres of land. “Naidu is solely responsible for shattering the dreams of farmers in the capital city region. Even after taking away farmers’ lands, he neither enhanced the tenancy amount nor hiked the pension for agriculture labourers,” Alla said. He added that the chief minister would not render injustice to any farmer in the capital city area and they should realise this fact.

Title: Haridwar seers offer differing views on appointment of Ram temple trust members
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Haridwar: Following the announcement of the trust that would oversee the construction and management of Ram temple in Ayodhya, divergent views have emerged from among the seers in Haridwar, where a few of them have raised objections over the nominated members of the trust.

While welcoming the formation of ‘Shri Ram Janmabhoomi Teerth Kshetra’ trust, Akhil Bharatiya Akhada Parishad president Narendra Giri objected to the nomination of Yogpurush Swami Paramanand from Haridwar, claiming that he was "not associated with the temple movement."

He also criticised the government for ignoring Nritya Gopal Das, president of the Ram Janmabhoomi Mandir Nyas.

“We are not happy with the nomination of Swami Paramanad as the member of the trust. Nevertheless, we won’t oppose it, as the construction of Ram temple is our foremost goal,” Giri told TOI.

Other seers such as Bhuma Niketan peethadhishwar Achyutanand Teerth and Shankaracharya Swami Swarupanand’s disciple, Avimukteshwaranand, were also not happy with the nomination of Vasudevanand Saraswati, the Shankaracharya from Jyotish Peeth.

Speaking to TOI, Avimukteshwaranand said, “The government, through the announcement of names for the trust, has sidelined the highest of the Hindu dharmacharyas.”

Meanwhile, other seers welcomed the announcement and expressed hope that the construction of Ram temple begins soon.

“This paves the way for construction of the Ram temple for which crores of Hindus have been waiting for decades,” seer Harichetananand said.

Another seer Paramanand opined, “Competent members from across the country have been chosen for the trust. As for Nritya Gopal Das, he has been the backbone of the temple movement and it makes no difference whether he is in the trust or not.”

Title: Council chairman appoints Buggana Rajendranath, Botcha Satyanarayana as heads of select committees
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Buggana Rajendranath

AMARAVATI: Notwithstanding YSRC’s resistance, legislative council chairman MA Shariff has appointed ministers Buggana Rajendranath and Botcha Satyanarayana as chairpersons of the select committees on the three capital cities and CRDA repeal bills.

The chairman also named a YSRC MLC in each select committee without getting recommendation from the party’s chief whip. After finalising the two panels, the chairman asked the legislature secretary to issue the notification and direct the select committees to begin the work.

MA Shariff had referred the controversial decentralisation of administration Bill and CRDA Repeal Bill to the select committees amidst uproar and a day-long logjam in the House on January, 22. The ruling YSRC government had protested the decision on the floor by raising slogans against the chairman. Subsequently, the AP assembly passed a resolution to abolish the legislative council in the state. The state government has already sent the resolution to the Union home ministry seeking introduction of a Bill to abolish the council in the Parliament. However, the council will continue to work till the Parliament clears the Bill and gets the President’s nod.

Meanwhile, YSRC pulled out all the stops to stall the constitution of the select committees by writing to the legislature secretary to not blindly follow the instructions of the chairman as he had violated the rules to use the discretionary powers. YSRC also refused to join the panels and turned down the chairman’s call to recommend members to the select committees.

After waiting for a week for YSRC’s response, chairman Shariff suo moto completed the process of appointing the select committees. Sources said finance minister Buggana Rajendranath has been made chairman of the committee to scrutinise the three capital cities Bill while municipal administration minister Botcha Satyanarayana will head the CRDA repeal Bill. It is not immediately clear whether the ministers will take up the job in wake of the party’s resistance to join the panels. The chairman is likely to change the chairpersons if the ministers refuse to head the committees.

Title: Power tariffs increased by 11 per cent across various sectors in Rajasthan
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Representative image

Title: Only 0.5% patients in state benefitted from Ayushman
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Bhopal: Only 2% of people registered under Ayushman Bharat ‘Niramayam’ MP (ABN-MP) directly benefited, by way of hospitalisation under the scheme, since its launch in September 2018, according to Union ministry of health and family welfare (MoHFW).

About 80% of state’s population is covered under the scheme. In effect, 0.005% of 5.28 crore people (or 14 crore families) eligible for the health scheme have benefitted. In MP, 73% of people who are eligible are yet to be covered under the national health protection scheme.

The MP government with grant in aid from the Centre, has spent Rs 231 crore since the scheme was launched benefitting 2.69 lakh patients, who got treatment under the scheme that provides cashless medical facility up to Rs 5 lakh at a private or government hospital of choice.

The average rate expenditure under the scheme was Rs 8,500 per patient in MP. Experts point out that about 40% of the treatment cost is not added to the bill, if the patient was hospitalised at a government-run facility. Meanwhile, Chhattisgarh spent Rs 424 crores on 7.69 lakh patients in the same period.

Health experts point out that about 10% of the population need hospitalisation each year. At present, only 1.96% of an estimated 5.28 crore people who are eligible for the scheme are benefitting. The situation has got more complicated for many, as provision of treatment under state illness fund has been merged with ABN-MP. As of January 2020, only 1.40 crore people have been issued ABN-MP insurance cards.

To improve the situation, criteria for empanelment of private hospitals under ABN-MP, has been made less stringent to increase the reach of the government healthcare insurance scheme, according to ABN-MP officials.

The decision was taken at an ABM-MP board meeting held recently. It recommended lowering of criteria, earlier limited to hospitals only with National Accreditation Board for Hospitals and Healthcare Providers known as NABH accreditation.

ABN-MP with 1.40 crore registrations, is the highest in the country. However, the number of private hospitals empanelled under the scheme in MP is only 94. There are 338 government hospitals and health centres. When contacted, ABN-MP senior officials did not respond.

***

Norms relaxed

Only 1.96% of 5.29 crore people got Ayushman Bharat benefit in MP

73% or about 3.88 crore people are yet to be issued Ayushman cards

Private hospitalisation under Ayushman Bharat made easy

NABH criteria lowered to benefit more and more people

44.31 lakh people were screened under the scheme

2.69 lakh got hospitalised under the scheme since Sept 2018

Per patient spend on hospitalisation under Ayushman Bharat in MP, was one of the highest

Title: UP, French can bond over platter: Envoy
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Vijay Chopra

Lucknow: Imagine galawati kebabs tickling the taste buds of French, and Awadh natives savouring the cassoulet. This delectable thought might become a reality as the natives of both France and Uttar Pradesh are great connoisseurs of food and appreciate platters that tickle their palate.

This idea has been mooted by the French ambassador to India, Emmanuel Lenain, who believes that UP and France can forge strong ties through the food route.

Speaking exclusively to TOI on the inaugural day of the Defence Expo, Lenain said, “Food industry is a great asset of French economy, and UP and France together can build new bridges in this sector.”

The ambassador sees immense scope for a fruitful association between his country and Uttar Pradesh given the growing urbanization of the country’s most populous state. He outlined water, sanitation, smart streets and transportation as key areas where the two governments can explore the opportunities of tie-ups.

Terming UP as a land with a rich culture and history, Lenain said French are aware of Awadh’s glorious past and have great respect for it.

In this light, the envoy stressed, more UP students could learn the French language and visit France to pursue higher education. “Also, more Indian tourists could visit our nation because human exchanges strengthen the bonding between countries,” the ambassador said, adding that they are keen to open more centres to teach French language in Uttar Pradesh.

The envoy said that after witnessing the magnitude of UP, French firms will surely consider investing in various sectors in the state and added that more than 60 companies from his country already have a strong presence in India.

Earlier in the day, speaking at a session on Indo-French relations, Lenain said the ties between the two nations have become stronger with every edition of the Defence Expo and pledged full support of his country to make in India projects. He termed this year’s Defence Expo as an incredible venue and a wonderful platform to explore global avenues. The ambassador said that the Indo-french asscoiation was the strongest in Asia-Pafific region.

Title: French artist challenges stereotypes with food-art
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

French artist Enora Lalet

Bhopal: French artist Enora Lalet, who creates art with food, is here in Bhopal to break stereotypes related to cultures and cuisines by experimenting with food-art, making accessories and ensembles made entirely out of fruits, vegetables and local dishes.

Lalet started her journey 10 years ago when she decided to challenge the stereotypes and cultural conditioning of citizens of different countries by creating objects that were out of their comfort zone and they did not have an opinion or judgment about it.

“Every culture — Indian, French or Indonesian etc — has its own stereotypes, taboos, judgements, stigmas and dogmas. Food is something that is very culture specific and the idea of mixing the two to create a third object appealed to me. When you see a portrait or a landscape, you know how you are supposed to react because of the conditioning of the mind by the cultures, but because of this, people forget who they really are. This is an effort to allow them to think outside their norms and accept, appreciate, criticize something they haven’t seen before and introspect. They can also challenge their beliefs and thought process this way,” said Lalet.

As Lalet is in Bhopal, she is looking forward to experiment with local fruits like bananas, grapes, oranges and seasonal vegetables along with Ayurveda and some mythology and Gond art.

“As India has rich medicinal herbs and I have been using Ayurveda since the past few years, I hope to use that. Gond art of Madhya Pradesh is very popular, so I will also be making use of the art form for the art work here. Besides, I have also planned to interchange colours of food and juices to disassociate the colours apportioned to fruits. You may pick up a blue juice and it may taste like bananas. This is also a practice to make people more accepting of new things,” she added.

In the first phase of the exhibition, Lalet has displayed some of her work from Indonesia and will be making around five more portraits with body paint and food with Indian models. The exhibition will be inaugurated at Alliance Francaise de Bhopal on Friday and Lalet will begin her new projects in the coming weeks.

Title: Cow vigilantes strike again, thrash 40-yr-old man from MP in Baran
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Kota: In yet another attack by cow vigilantes , a 40-year-old man was thrashed by a dozen youths of Gau Rakshak Dal on the intervening night of Wednesday and Thursday on Sarhtal Ghati Road under Sarthal police station of Baran district.

The alleged cow smuggler, Laxminarayan Lodha, who belongs to Nareda village of Rajgarh district in Madhya Pradesh, has been arrested by the police on a complaint filed by Gau Rakshak Dal members.

During questioning, Lodha stated that he had purchased six calves from Baran district and was transporting them to his native village for farming.

A case has now been registered against him for transporting calves in excess of capacity of the vehicle. Lodha was manhandled and thrashed by members of the vigilante group and has sustained injuries, according to the police. But the victim has refused to file a complaint against ‘gau rakshaks’.

“He has been booked under sections 5, 8, 9 of the Cow Protection Act for transporting more calves in excess of the capacity of vehicle,” Sarthal police station SHO Parmanand Meena said.

At least six calves have been rescued from the pick-up vehicle and sent to a local ‘gaushala’, he added.

Police were first alerted about the alleged cow smuggling by the head of local Gau Rakshak Dal Ajay Tyagi at around 1am on Thursday, informing that the vigilantes had stopped a pick-up vehicle packed with calves on Sarthal Ghati Road.

Police reached the spot and rescued six calves and arrested its driver Lodha. Two others who were with him managed to flee from the spot.

“A medical examination has been done on Lodha. If he submits a complaint for being manhandled and thrashed by ‘gau rakshaks, we will register a case,” the SHO said.

A video of the incident too has surfaced in which Lodha can be seen being held by the vigilantes and beaten up severely even as he apologises and says ‘sorry’, claiming that he is not a cow smuggler but a farmer.

Title: Andhra Pradesh: Sri Lankan PM Mahinda Rajapaksa to visit Tirumala on February 10
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Mahinda Rajapaksa

VIJAYAWADA: Sri Lankan Prime Minister Mahinda Rajapaksa is set to visit Lord Venkateswara temple on February 10. According to TTD officials, they have received an official communiqué with this regard from the Centre and are making necessary arrangements for his visit.

Officials said the Lankan PM will leave his country on February 10 evening and arrive at Renigunta airport and travel to the temple on the same day. On February 11 morning, he would offer prayers to Lord Venkateswara during Suprabhata Seva. He is likely to leave for Sri Lanka on the same day.

Title: Uttar Pradesh: Ignored in temple trust, first Dalit seer cries foul
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Kanhaiya Prabhunand Giri

LUCKNOW: Kanhaiya Prabhunand Giri — the first Dalit to be appointed mahamandaleswar of Juna Akhara after six centuries — is sore over being ignored by the government in the newly-formed Ram Temple Trust.

Speaking to TOI from his ashram in Azamgarh on Thursday, the 32-year-old mahamandaleswar, who took a historic dip at Sangam during Kumbh last year to break the centuries-old caste taboo, said his high post now becomes a “mere formality” as the government has overlooked him while appointing a Dalit member to the trust.

“You put a Dalit on a high post but do not repose faith in him or give him the responsibility when it is required for a grand work. Ayodhya is in UP, Ram Mandir will be in UP and I am from Azamgarh in UP. I should have been consulted and made a part of the trust. Formality na kariye, vishwas jitiye (You need to win our trust rather than indulging in formality),” he said.

Giri said he stood by Ayodhya seers who are also upset over being ignored for the Ram Temple Trust despite their contribution to the Ram temple movement. “Main in santon ke saath hoon. I will hold discussions with them soon,” he added.

Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Wednesday had announced the formation of a trust for the construction of Ram temple in Ayodhya as mandated by the Supreme Court in its Ayodhya verdict.

The Dalit mahamandaleshwar had claimed during Kumbh that his mission was to ensure “ghar wapsi” of SCs, STs and OBCs who had left sanatan dharm following their exploitation due to a dogmatic caste system.

“Both PM Modi and Union home minister Amit Shah had visited Kumbh and performed rituals but neither of them met me or enquired about me even though I had made history by undertaking a ‘shahi snan,” he added.

The mahamandaleswar had arrived in a golden chariot, flanked by his followers for the holy dip at Sangam last year.

Title: US deported 1,600 Indians last year
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Representative image

JALANDHAR: The United States in 2019 deported 1,616 Indians, the highest in any single year since 2014, according to data obtained from the US Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE). A total of 8,447 Indian nationals were detained in ICE facilities last year for violating immigration laws, information provided last month under the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) has revealed.

In 2018, the US immigration authorities detained 9,818 Indians (including 359 women), the highest till now. The same year, 611 Indians were deported from the US.

The ICE data has also revealed that among the 8,447 “ICE initial bookings (sic) of Indian nationals by gender” 422 were women, 8,022 were men while gender of three was not clear to the American authorities. This is about four times when compared with the 2014 number when 2,306 Indian nationals were detained in ICE facilities. Notably, the number of women in the ICE detention centres is increasing almost in the same proportion.

This trend has been highlighted in viral videos of a series of instances involving Punjabi-speaking women and children trying to enter illegally through Mexico last year. In the second week of June last year, a six-year-old girl died in Arizona desert as her mother, who was from Haryana and trying to get reunited with her husband already in the US, had taken her along to illegally cross the American border via Mexico. Later, a video of her mother alighting from a bus, apparently in Mexico, along with some others including another woman and her daughter became viral on social media.

In third week of July 2019, two video clips became viral on social media platforms, especially among Punjabi netizens in which Punjabi men and women were seen crossing a border fence, said to be Mexico-US border, along with their children. They could be heard speaking in Punjabi.

These instances highlighted that not only Punjabi men, but women too were desperate to reach the US and were taking kids along them.

North American Punjabi Association (NAPA) executive director Satnam Singh Chahal had on November 2 sought information from ICE on number of Indian males and females deported every year from 2014 to 2019 and number of males and females of Indian origin in ICE facilities in the same period.

Releasing the information through a letter dated January 30, 2020, FOIA officer Catrina M Pavlik-Keenan stated that ICE has claimed no deletions or exemptions.

“Although there is no record of deported persons belonging to Punjab, it is believed that most are from the region. Growing number of Indian-origin illegal migrants is a serious matter of concern for all of us and the Government of India and State of Punjab as illegal immigrants have been moving through Mexico, Arizona and Texas in the United States. These undocumented persons of Indian origin are hoping to reach the US after expensive, arduous, and often dangerous journeys that can take months or even years and can sometimes be fatal,” he added.

Title: Uttar Pradesh: Obscure Dhannipur village basks in its mosque glory
Content:
Land in Dhannipur identified for construction of a mosque

AYODHYA: The nondescript Dhannipur village on the Lucknow-Faizabad highway has suddenly shot into limelight after the UP government identified land for a mosque here. The annual urs at the neighbouring Shahzaad Shah dargah is the only time when the quiet village comes alive. Villagers are hopeful that Dhannipur will now be catapulted to the global map.Residents are basking in their new-found glory and are hoping to get a development fillip, as according to sources in the government, the Sunni Central Waqf Board will be handed over the land with better amenities and wide roads.Dhannipur is situated in Sohawal tehsil of Faizabad. The government has allotted 5 acre of land of the agriculture department, 200m away from Lucknow-Faizabad-Gorakhpur national highway, behind Raunahi police station.Pradhan of Dhannipur village, Rakesh Yadav said, “Now our village will be famous as people from all over the globe would visit the mosque here and offer prayers. Here, not only Muslims, but even the Hindu community is ready to welcome the mosque and offer assistance in its construction.”Ayodhya BJP MLA, Ved Prakash Gupta said, “I will be visiting the village soon to meet members of the Muslim community and personally offer my assistance in the construction of the mosque”.Haji Saleem, a local businessman, said, “As the Hindu devotees from across the world will visit Ayodhya after the construction of the Ram Mandir, likewise Muslims from all over the world will visit Dhannipur for offering prayers at the mosque. It will definitely boost the local economy and will bring about development.”A local resident, Aarti Devi said, “We already have four mosques in the village, but now this grand mosque will give a new identity to the village. It will definitely bring good luck for the village.”

Title: Karnataka: Politicians on tenterhooks as IMA probe spreads net
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

On Tuesday, the CBI indicted two senior IPS officers

BENGALURU: Politicians allegedly involved in the I-Monetary Advisory (IMA) ponzi scam are on tenterhooks given that bureaucrats and senior police officers are being arraigned. The Central Bureau of Investigation, probing the case, has named three bureaucrats, including an IAS officer, and registered an FIR against two IPS officers and three police officials.

The main accused and IMA founder Mohammad Mansoor Ali Khan is currently in judicial custody.

“It’s heartening that sleuths are investigating some top cops. But, we’re disappointed at the progress as not even a single politician is being brought to book,” said social activist Haris Siddique who is trying to get justice for investors.

R Roshan Baig, disqualified Congress MLA, and former minister and Congress legislator BZ Zameer Ahmad Khan are among politicians who were linked to the scam, as were former chief minister HD Kumaraswamy and former revenue minister RV Deshpande.

Apart from SIT, which probed the case earlier, recording Baig’s statement and CBI questioning Zameer, there has been no action against politicians.

The scam was busted open after Mansoor Ali Khan accused Baig of being a party to the scheme in which 75,000 investors lost about Rs 3,500 crore. Khan alleged that Baig took Rs 400 crore from him and refused to return it. He had also alleged that Baig had promised him to bail him out by using his influence in the JD (S)-Congress coalition government.

Then revenue minister Deshpande had admitted that Baig had arranged his meeting with Khan, when the latter sought a clean chit from the revenue department to avail a Rs 6,000 bank loan. When the revenue department decided to attach the property and put up a public notice about it in November 2018, the Kumaraswamy-led government chose to withdraw the notice. Subsequently, he officially gave a letter of commendation to Mansoor Ali Khan for his social service.

Using the letter, the BS Yediyurappa-led BJP government, that took over in July last year, hinted that Kumaraswamy would be prosecuted.

Baig declined to comment on the allegation that politicians are getting preferential treatment. “I was the one to first demand a CBI probe. Let it do its job,” he said.

AYV Krishna, joint director, CBI, said the investigation will take its own course, adding: “All culprits, irrespective of their post and position, will be be booked.”

Title: Coronavirus in Rajasthan: In a major lapse, 24-day delay in isolating Rajasthan students from Wuhan
Content:
Representative image

No positive case of coronavirus reported in Rajasthan so far

JAIPUR: Twenty-four days after they returned from the troubled China’s Wuhan, the epicentre of novel coronavirus (nCoV) outbreak, three medical students were quarantined at an isolation ward in Sawai Man Singh (SMS) Hospital on Thursday. The delay could be a major lapse in preventing nCoV in Rajasthan.Quick in defending the delay in testing, health authorities claimed that these students were not cooperating with them despite repeated efforts made to convince them.Only after chief medical health officer (CMHO) Jaipur-I Dr Narottam Sharma directed his officials in Govindgarh to convince these students for testing for nCoV, the students agreed to undergo the test. “We issued directions to get the test done of these students immediately. If required take the help of the administration (even police),” Dr Sharma told TOI.They were brought to SMS Hospital, where the doctors quarantined them after taking their blood samples.These students had reached Jaipur on January 13 and since then they have been living in Govindgarh. “Two students got their tests done some days ago but three students had refused saying they do not have any symptoms,” said Dr SK Chopra, block chief medical officer, Govindgarh.In Barmer too, health authorities had to make a lot of effort to convince people returning from Wuhan. “Five people returned from Wuhan in Barmer, all of them have been quarantined at the government hospital. Initially, these students showed resistance but they later agreed to cooperate,” said Dr Kamlesh Chaudhary, CMHO, Barmer.Besides, two more people were quarantined in Jodhpur on Thursday.So far, 51 samples of people who returned from Wuhan have been taken and out of those 43 have tested negative and report of eight tests is awaited. Moreover, 6,981 passengers who landed in Jaipur over the last 10 days have been screened. No nCoV positive case has been reported from the state so far.Rajasthan is at high-risk of nCoV as many medical students, along with others, have returned from Wuhan. At a time when Kerala has reported three confirmed nCoV cases, all those returning from Wuhan have been categorised as suspected cases for nCoV. To enforce the Centre’s direction making it mandatory for all Wuhan-returned citizens to undergo test for nCoV, health authorities are identifying such people and convincing them of taking the test.

Title: Seer revolt brews, but MHA call douses fire in Ayodhya
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Nritya Gopal Das (extreme left) with CM Yogi Adityanath

Ayodhya: Twenty-four hours after the Centre announced formation of the Ram temple trust, Mani Ram Das Chawni temple in Ayodhya turned into an epicentre of revolt by seers with 82-year-old mahant and president of VHP-run Ramjanmabhoomi Nyas, Nritya Gopal Das, leading the protests against exclusion of those who spearheaded the decades-old Ram temple movement.

But before the mahant could address a press conference of the sant samaj to air their grievance and chart out a future course of action, a phone call from Union home ministry doused the fire for the time being. Earlier, the mahant expressed anger at not being made a trustee even as he considered himself a front-runner for the apex temple body’s top post. “Those who sacrificed their lives for the temple movement have been ignored,” he told TOI.Before the Delhi hotline crackled, the BJP brass in Lucknow swiftly dispatched three emissaries — BJP MLA Ved Prakash Gupta, Ayodhya Mayor Rishikesh Upadhyay and Ayodhya Mahanagar president Abhishek Mishra — to placate the seers. The agitated sadhus stopped the three BJP leaders from entering Ram Das Chawni temple and forced them to return. Soon, Mahant Nritya Gopal Das summoned an emergency meeting of sadhus and scheduled a press meeting at 5pm, only to cancel the media meet after a call from Delhi.

Talking to TOI, Ayodhya MLA Ved Prakash Gupta said, “We have pacified the mahant after he had a telephonic conversation with Union home minister Amit Shah. Three posts are still vacant in the trust and Mahant Das will be adjusted.”

Mahant Kamal Nayan Das, designated successor to Nritya Gopal Das, said the Vaishnav Samaj had been ignored and the trust is not acceptable. Commenting on the inclusion of Ayodhya royal Bimlendra Mohan Pratap Mishra, he said he was a politician who contested on a BSP ticket. “Mishra did not play any role in the temple movement,” he said. Mahant Suresh Das of Digambar Akhara too vehemently opposed the trust. “Where are those who fought for the Ram temple,” he asked.

Talking to TOI, Triloki Nath Pandey, who holds the decree of Ramjanmabhoomi as mandated by the Supreme Court, said, “Nyas president Nritya Gopal Das and VHP vice-president Champat Rai are an accused in the Babri demolition case. So, they have not been included. By March, their trial will conclude and they will be included in the Trust.”

Title: Sedition case: Protesters pose 20 questions to Karnataka top cop
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

An activist holds placards during a protest in front of the police headquarters in Bengaluru on Thursday

BENGALURU: Terming the sedition case against a Bidar school and parent over children ’s performance of a play a mockery of democracy, around 100 protesters gathered outside the office of director general and inspector general of police (DG & IGP) in Bengaluru on Thursday. They demanded action against Bidar cops for harassing schoolchildren in the name of investigation.

Lining the pavement outside the office on Nrupatunga Road, the protesters displayed placards asking 20 questions. Tanveer Ahmed, a participant, said, “We have 20 questions for the state police and want them to be answered. It is scary that schoolchildren are being interrogated like adult criminals.”

The questions include, ‘Why no action was taken against those who enacted the play, Demolition of Babri Masjid’ in Mangaluru; ‘Will police monitor plays and other school activities’; ‘What action is the DGP taking against the Bidar SP?’

Later, a delegation of the protesters met DG & IGP Praveen Sood, seeking his intervention in the matter. “Police in uniform entered the school and thereby violated the juvenile justice law. Where’s the need to question the children repeatedly,” they asked.

“Are Karnataka police scared of children questioning the system and have, therefore, arrested a parent and a teacher in Bidar?” they wanted to know. The protesters claimed Sood has promised to look into the matter.

Title: Six FIRs against white ration card holders in Amaravati land scam
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Representative image

HYDERABAD: Andhra Pradesh CID issued six FIRs in Amaravati land scam against white ration cardholders who purchased valuable lands worth crores of rupees. The cases were booked based on a complaint filed by Penamaluru tahsildar G Bhadru. All six cases were booked under criminal conspiracy, cheating by furnishing false information, dishonest misappropriation of property and using forged documents.

The allegation is that the accused obtained a white ration card by submitting fabricated information and misappropriated the government schemes after obtaining white ration cards. The CID found that 797 BPL white ration card holders bought 761 acres of land worth Rs 220 crore in Amaravati.

One Abdul Jamedhar owns one acre of land in Rayapudi of Mangalagiri mandal, but probe revealed that he owns ground plus one building at Ganguru village. In second case, one Polineni Konadala Rao owns one acre of land at Nelapadu that he gave to the government under land pooling scheme and got 1,078 square yards of residential plot and 200 square yards of commercial plot.

In another case, an accused, Mandava Nagamani, owns 0.95 cents in Venkatapalem in Mangalagiri, but probe revealed that she owns ground plus two building in Padmanabhapuram in Poranki. Another accused Mandava Anuradha purchased one acre of land in Venkatapalem of Mangalagiri and enquiry revealed that she owns a duplex house in Kanuru.

Another card holder, Bollineni Narasimha Rao, owns 0.42 cents in Venkatapalem in Mangalagiri and enquiry revealed that he is a retired railway employee having ground plus two building in Porankai. In one of the cases, accused Bhukya Nagamani, a resident of Poranki in Penamulur mandal, purchased 0.25 cents of land in Nelapadu of Thulluru, Guntur district. Enquiries revealed that Nagamani works in Punjab National Bank and her husband work as AE in Vijayawada Thermal power station.

CID also issued FIR against former TDP ministers Prathipati Pulla Rao and P Narayana based on the complaint filed by a Dalit woman.

Title: Hyderabad: 19 road widening proposals approved
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

GHMC

HYDERABAD: GHMC standing committee on Thursday approved 24 agendas and most of them were road-widening proposals.

In total, 19 road widening proposals were approved that included road from Vittal Rao Nagar to Madhapur main road by acquiring eight properties and road connecting Nizampet Cross Road to Hitex Junction via Vasanth Nagar. The proposal to allot an exclusive land in Krishnaiah Nagar Colony, Fathullaguda, was also approved.

Title: Universities’ rivalry behind attack at SDM office in Chattarpur?
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

On Wednesday, masked men had vadalised the office of the SDM

Bhopal: A day after the sensational attack at the office of sub divisional magistrate (SDM) in Chattarpur, the police claimed to have collected some important clues. Statements of a number of people associated with the case, including the SDM, were recorded by the cops.

On Wednesday afternoon, five masked men had vadalised the office and car of SDM Anil Sapkale. The intruders had also fired some gunshots in the air. All this happened while the SDM was sitting inside his office. His nameplate was broken and thrown on the floor. Though the armed miscreants shouted and abused while vandalising the properties, the SDM was not harmed. After the incident, Sapkale had said , “As I am involved in the campaign against mafia in Chattarpur, they may be behind the incident and targeting me.”

Additional SP Chattarpur, Jaiaraj Kuber, said, “During the investigation, we received some important leads when we went through the call records of some of the people allegedly involved in the attack. This will help crack the case.” The police suspect rivalry between two private universities of Chattarpur behind the incident. Officials of one of the universities were booked last month. Owners of both the universities belong to Bandaa and Mahoba districts of Uttar Pradesh. “We have questioned the representatives of these universities,” the ASP said.

Following the incident, all the SDMs posted in the district reached the headquarter and urged action against the people involved in the case. They also threatened to go on strike in case the accused are not arrested in three days. SDM’s office is located right across the SP’s bungalow.

Title: ‘Defunct’ green lane at Kishanpole to get a repaint
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Jaipur: The Jaipur Smart City Ltd has begun repainting the green corridor which was earmarked for non-motorised vehicles (NMV), along the Kishanpole Road in the Walled City.

This 700-feet long dedicated corridor, which was laid under the Smart Road Project last year, is being renovated this year. But it has largely remained defunct due to encroachments and congested roads. It was expected to provide swift passage to e-rickshaws and cycles in the Walled City area.

CEO of the Jaipur Smart City Ltd, Lok Bandhu said the idea could have been a success, but to remove the encroachment is the responsibility of the Jaipur Municipal Corporation and traffic police. “Our work was to pave the green lane. We do not have any executive powers and other departments have to be vigilant,” Lok Bandhu said.

There is, however, no justification in repainting the corridor. “The road is already congested and I have never seen any e-rickshaw plying on it.
