This was despite a nearly 12% rise in consolidated revenue from operations for Q3FY20 at Rs 5895 crore from Rs 5270 crore in Q3FY19.

The company said that while international business accounted for 92% of revenues during the quarter, domestic market contributed only 8%. It also said that while its formulaions business grew 17.4% during the quarter to Rs 5105 crore the quarter and accounted for 86.6% of total revenues, the API business de-grew by over 14% with sales of Rs 790 crore as against Rs 922 crore in the third quarter of FY19. While US formulations sales grew 22% to Rs 2969 crore and accounted for over 50% of consolidated revenues, EU formulations business clocked 14% growth to Rs 1476 crore, accounting for 25% of consolidated revenues.

On the other hand, ARV formulations sales rose 11% during Q3FY20 at Rs 313 crore from Rs 281 crore in Q3FY19 and contributed 5.3% of revenue, while growth market formulations went up by 1.6% to Rs 346 crore from Rs 340.5 crore in Q3FY19 and accounted for 5.9% of revenue.

Commenting on the performance, Aurobindo Pharma MD N Govindarajan said: “We continue to perform well across all geographies. We remain focused on strengthening our existing businesses and developing a differentiated and specialty driven product portfolio. We are committed to resolve all regulatory issues and continuously improve quality.”

Title: Forest minister directs officials to tackle forest fires effectively this year
Content:
The officials have identified 13,917 kilometres of forest lines out of which only 5,000 kms has been created so far

Haridwar: State forest minister Harak Singh Rawat on Thursday conducted a meeting of forest officials in Rudraprayag and directed them to ensure that forest fires are tackled effectively this season.“This year, the forest department will try to minimize fire using the best technology and ensure that fire incidences don’t cross last year’s mark,” Rawat said at the meeting.Notably, the forest department is yet to demarcate fire lines across the 13 districts to prevent spreading of wildfires.The officials have identified 13,917 kilometres of forest lines out of which only 5,000 kms has been created so far.Giving reasons for not demarcating the forest line, the forest officials at the meeting said, “Snowfall and erratic weather played a spoilsport in clearing the fire lines.”Last year, around 3,844 hectares of forest cover was gutted in wildfires, and the department pegged the loss at Rs 75 lakh.For handling the wildfire situation, the department has set up 40 master control rooms, 175 watchtowers and availability of crew members across all 1, 437 crew stations.

Title: Gujarat: 3 from Kadi test negative for coronavirus
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Representative image

AHMEDABAD: Three youths from Kadi in Mehsana district, who had just returned from Thailand, were sent to the Asarwa Civil Hospital on Thursday for medical check-ups. The youths had complained of cold, sore throats and mild body pain.

Dr Gunvant Rathod, medical superintendent, Civil Hospital, said that the youths had common flu and their screening did not reveal signs associated with coronavirus. “They were provided primary treatment and were prescribed medication,” he said.

State health department officials said that the report of a 28-year-old woman from Ambli, who is quarantined at Civil Hospital for possible coronavirus infection, is expected on Friday.

Title: Man arrested for sharing obscene images of minor in Facebook
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Representative image

HARIDWAR: A 23-year-old man was arrested on Thursday for allegedly sharing obscene images of random men and women and minors on Facebook.

The accused was using a fake Id on Facebook and was using the mobile number issued by his employer, police said.

A case was registered by the police after getting a complaint from the National Cyber Crime Reporting Portal (NCCRP) following Facebook red-flagged it.

The accused has been identified as Shiv Prakash, resident of Saptrishi, who works in a cow shelter home.

SHO city police station Praveen Singh Koshiyari told TOI, “A case has been registered against two accused under section 67 b of IT act and section 13/14 of the POCSO Act. Accused Shiv Prakash had made a fake ID under the name of Akhil Rathor and posted obscene images. His employer Suryakant Sharma who is the owner of the cow shelter home had given the SIM card on his ID. Suryakant did not know about the activities of Shiv Prakash.”

Title: Kochi: New technique offers hope to heart patients
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Photo for representative purpose only

KOCHI: A new treatment option — coronary shockwave lithotripsy balloon — offers hope to patients who develop block in heart due to severe calcification almost 20 to 25 years after bypass surgery. The usual angioplasty technique is not possible on such patients.

A 76-year-old patient, who had undergone bypass surgery almost 29 years ago, underwent the new procedure at Lisie Hospital , and 90% of the block was removed. This is the first time the technique has been used in Kerala.

Cardiologists at the hospital, who found that the patient’s block was severely calcified, inserted a ‘balloon’ into the coronary arteries of the patient and sonic pressure pulses were delivered via emitters in the ‘balloon’, which weakens and breaks the calcium. After this, the block was opened and stent implanted successfully.

“This would be extremely useful for those suffering from advanced form of coronary artery disease, having angina or heart attack in which the blockages become very hard due to deposit of calcium. This happens in 15% to 20% of patients undergoing angioplasty and stenting, especially those who are old, diabetic, having chronic kidney disease or who had undergone bypass surgery,” said cardiologist Dr Rony Mathew, who headed the team that performed the surgery.

“Such blocks until now were opened with high pressure balloons or by rotablation procedure, which won’t work for deep and extensive calcified arteries. This therapy has made complex angioplasty much safer and quicker,” said Dr Jabir A, who was part of the team.

Title: Multi-crore SC/ST scholarship scam: SIT books 7 more educational institutes
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Dehradun: The Special Investigation Team (SIT) probing the multi-crore SC/ST scholarship scam booked seven educational institutes – one in Dehradun and six in Uttar Pradesh – for their alleged involvement in the fraud. These cases were lodged on Wednesday in Dalanwala and Basant Vihar police station of Dehradun.

With this, the total number of cases lodged in the scam has gone up to 52. Cases have been registered against 79 educational institutes of different states – Uttar Pradesh, Himachal Pradesh, Uttarakhand and Haryana. The accused educational institutes allegedly used forged documents to avail the benefits of SC/ST scholarship fund provided by the social welfare department.

Sharing information, IPS officer Manjunath, who is heading the SIT, said, “In the initial probe, we have found ample evidence against these educational institutes therefore a case has been registered against them. Further action will be initiated on basis of future findings.”

He added that the SIT has booked educational institutes of UP, Himachal Pradesh, Haryana and Uttarakhand for their alleged involvement in the scam.

The SIT booked seven educational institutes under section 420 (cheating), 409 (criminal breach of trust by public servant), 467 (forgery of valuable security), 468 (forgery for purpose of cheating) and 471 (using forged document as genuine one) of Indian Penal Code (IPC).

Sources added that the first case in the matter was registered in Haridwar on December 1, 2018. In Dehradun, the first case was registered on February 4, 2019. “It is too early to tell the exact scholarship amount misused by these institutes as some funds were provided to the actual beneficiaries also. Our teams are working and finding out more details in the matter,” a source said.

Title: After IIFA, state to host singing finale
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Bhopal : Kamal Nath-led Madhya Pradesh government is all set to go for another glamorous event soon, to give a fillip to its brand image. After IIFA awards, which were announced in a mega event at Bhopal recently the government will now host a grand musical event, `Indian Idol', in the state capital later this month. BJP has, however, dubbed the move as misuse of government funds.

“Mere announcement of the International IIFA Awards has given a boost to the state’s tourism industry. The government will now host a musical extravaganza, Indian Idol, in Bhopal. The mega event will be held on February 20 at TT Nagar stadium," said state public relations minister, PC Sharma, on Thursday.

“MP had been known for Bhopal gas tragedy till now. Hosting IIFA here will give a global status to the culturally rich state and the heart of ‘Incredible India’. This function is going to provide a new identity to MP," Nath had said during the announcement of IIFA, on February 3. Minister Sharma said that forthcoming musical event is also focused on giving a major boost to the tourism sector as music lovers from across the world would choose MP to witness such gala events.

"It will be the 11th grand finale of the contest, where 15 finalists will perform before the public in the presence of celebrities, including Himesh Reshammiya, Neha Kakkar and Vishal Dadlani," said Sharma.

The BJP has dubbed the event as overspending by the cash-strapped government. “The government is crying itself hoarse over financial crisis. Now it is trying to favour its `business friends’ at the cost of state funds, in the name of big events and entertainment. It would have been better if they had given preference to distressed farmers and agitating guest scholars, who are sitting on a month-long protest for their justified rights,” said BJP state spokesperson, Rajneesh Agrawal.

Title: DefExpo 2020: Army veterans’ cap sold in two hours at souvenir stalls
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Compilation of letters from heroes of Kargil war was a showstopper at souvenir stalls

LUCKNOW: Guess what sold like hot cakes at the souvenir stalls on Day Two of DefExpo 2020 on Gomti Riverfront? The army veterans’ cap . In fact, such high was the demand that both stalls selling the keepsake exhausted stocks in two hours of opening. Kartikey Verma, a student who managed to bag the last piece, couldn’t stop saying how lucky he was. “Some people are offering to pay me a premium for the cap, but I am not going to sell it. I shall take it to school and show it to my friends,” he beamed.

Lady Luck evidently didn’t favour everyone on Thursday. Varun Khati was among those sulking. “I had bought a veterans’ cap yesterday (Wednesday), but gave it to my younger brother who wanted it. I thought I’d buy another today, but they were sold out,” Varun said, adding that he was now planning to trade a comic book for the cap with his sibling.

Apart from the caps, souvenir badges of the armed forces, pencil boxes and notepads with pictures of tanks and missiles were also on demand. Visitor Nakul Khanna said his son had bought 12 navy and IAF badges. “He has a fancy dress competition at school and perhaps plans to floor his friends as a senior defence officer.”

If youngsters and the youth eyed badges and caps, senior citizens browsed pens exclusively used by army officers, wallets, ties and wall clocks.

Title: Bill to increase wards in local bodies introduced
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

THIRUVANANTHAPURAM: Kerala assembly, on Thursday, referred to the subject committee the Kerala Panchayat Raj (Amendment) Bill, 2020 and Kerala Municipality (Amendment) Bill, 2020, which are intended to increase the number of wards in all local bodies by one each, despite several points of order raised by the opposition.

Expected to be enacted in the current session, the bills were introduced since governor Arif Mohammed Khan refused to promulgate an ordinance for the purpose last month. “The governor, who returned the ordinance, suggested the government to bring in a legislation instead of an ordinance. The bills are being presented after the governor approved the drafts,” LSGD minister A C Moideen told the assembly, while presenting the bills.

Opposition members’ points of order were on three grounds — violation of Census Act 1948 which prohibits changing administrative boundaries once census procedures are on, the high court judgment in 2015 restricting delimitation before the 2021 census, and the financial memorandums in the bills which dismiss any additional expenditure from the state’s consolidated fund. “The bills are strictly legal, and they are not in violation of the Census Act or the high court verdict,” the minister said.

Moideen clarified that the government was not changing administrative boundaries of panchayats and other local bodies, but only increasing the number of wards, ‘which are not administrative bodies’. “It’s a rectification of the anomaly of the delimitation process the UDF government carried out in 2015, which covered only 82 out of the total 1,200 local bodies,” he pointed out.

The writ petition filed before the high court in 2015 was for delimitation of a panchayat against which the government filed an affidavit for a favourable court verdict, the minister said. “Here, the government has no intention for delimitation of panchayats but for only the wards,” he said. On the minister’s clarifications, speaker P Sreeramakrishnan ruled that the points of orders do not stand and the bill was referred to the subject committee after discussions. The minister also dismissed opposition members’ allegations that the LDF government was making a hasty delimitation of wards eyeing the local body elections to be held in October 2020.

Queried by the opposition, whether the delimitation procedures would be complete before October 2020 for a smooth conduct of the election, Modieen said the matter was being handled by the delimitation committee headed by the election commission.

Title: Police plan 8am to 10pm ban on entry of heavy vehicles into Nashik
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Representative image

NASHIK: A ban on entry of heavy vehicles into the city between 8am and 10pm is being planned to address the issue of traffic congestion and accidents, said commissioner of police Vishwas Nangare Patil on Thursday.

“Diversion of heavy vehicles has not only eased congestion in the Dwarka area but also on other roads in the heart of the city,” said the police chief.

Nangare Patil said that such rules have been implemented in bigger cities, and it can be enforced in Nashik too because of increasing number of vehicles and traffic congestion .

The police chief said that an officer of the rank of PSI and four staffers, along with students from an architecture college, have been studying 85 junctions in the city to recommend traffic control measures.

“We are planning to take action against motorists found parking their vehicles on roads. A large number of vehicles can be found parked on the twin service roads along the Mumbai-Agra highway. These vehicles obstruct the flow of traffic,” he said.

Police authorities said the ban from 8am to 10pm would be implemented after talks with traders, adding that heavy vehicles could halt at the truck termini at both ends of the city on the highway. Earlier, drivers would halt near the Octroi posts.

Police said that there would not be any major bandobast in the area for the next two to three months.

Title: Jeweller shot dead by two assailants who flee with documents bag
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

The CCTV recording of the entire evening was thoroughly checked and a list of suspects has been prepared

BAREILLY: A jewellery shop owner was shot dead allegedly by unidentified assailants who were wearing helmets in Subhashnagar locality here on Wednesday night. The victim, Kamal Kishore Verma (42), was about to close his shop when two masked men entered and shot him twice. One of the assailants picked up a small bag in the shop, which contained some documents, before the duo fled on their bike.

Kamal Kishore was rushed to the district hospital by his brother with the help of Dial 112 team, but he breathed his last within a few minutes while doctors were attending to him. Police are trying to identify the killers. It is suspected that the assailants were known to the victim as robbery does not seem to be the motive behind the murder.

After getting information about the incident, DIG Rajesh Pandey , SSP Shailesh Pandey and SP (crime) RK Bhartiya rushed to the spot and took stock of the situation. Police have recovered the CCTV footage of the entire incident and found that the assailants fled in the direction of Madinath temple on their bike.

The CCTV recording of the entire evening was thoroughly checked and a list of suspects has been prepared.

Kamal Kishore is survived by his widow, Neelam, son Ansh, 12, and two daughters – Riya, 7, and Lali, 4. He used to live in a joint family. His elder brother deals in the supply of tailoring goods.

Expressing his inability to figure out why Kamal Kishore was killed, his father Omkar Verma said his son did not have any enmity with anyone.

Bhartiya told TOI, “Both killers were carrying pistols and fired three bullets at the victim. The victim seems to have known the assailants as he did not show any signs of panic when they entered his shop. The assailants did not touch any jewellery in the shop and picked up a small document bag. We are investigating the case from all angles and will question family members after the cremation to get details about the suspects. We are trying to find the bike which was used by the killers. Its image may have been captured by other CCTV cameras installed in the market. The assailants will soon be arrested.”

Title: SDM & 2 officials booked on court order for EWS flat fraud
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Gurgaon: Six people, including a sub-divisional magistrate (SDM), a naib teshildar and a revenue clerk, have been booked for corruption and fraud. The case was registered upon the direction of a court for illegal registry of flats bought by a buyer belonging to the economically weaker section (EWS) within months of allotment. An EWS flat , according to the rules, can’t be sold in the first five years from the allotment date.

In July 2018, an EWS flat was allotted to a buyer — Kamla in Shishpal Vihar Society in Sector 49 — but within 40 days, the flat was sold to a person identified as Vijay Singh in violation of the rules. Revenue officials, who were aware ofthe rules, executed the registry.

The matter was highlighted by Ramesh Kumar, a resident of Manesar. Kumar raised the issue before chief minister Manohar Lal Khattar during a grievance committee meeting in Gurgaon in November 2018, following which an inquiry was conducted by the additional deputy commissioner of Gurgaon, and the report was submitted to the deputy commissioner in May 2019. The report indicted the seller, the buyer and the officials and staff of the tehshil office of Badshapur for impropriety. It also recommended action against the erring officials. After receiving the report, the deputy commissioner wrote several letters to the SDM between June and November last year to initiate legal action against “corrupt” officials.

According to the rules, the developer of a private colony has to allot around 20% of the flats or plots to people from economically weaker section at subsidised rates and the allottee cannot sell his property for five years . In this case, the flat was sold within 40 days of handover.

Kumar said when no action was taken by the authorities despite direction from the deputy commissioner, he filed a fresh complaint with the deputy commissioner again seeking action against the accused. He also approached the police with a complaint on January 26, but no action was taken. Finally, he filed a case before Gurgaon court in the first week of February, and taking cognizance of the matter, additional sessions judge Ashwani Kumar on Tuesday directed registration of FIR.

“All accused involved in the criminal conspiracy and corruption committed an offence of fraud by misusing their official position,” said complainant Ramesh Kumar. Upon the direction of the court, a case was registered against allottee Kamla (seller), Vijay Singh (buyer), naib tehshildar Dalbir Dugal, registry clerk Vikash Sharma. The SDM and other revenue officials did not respond to the calls and text messages by TOI, while deputy commissioner Amit Khatri said a case has been registered, and the police will investigate.

Title: Jaipur police arrest three for looting truck with copper worth Rs 1.75 crore
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Representative image

JAIPUR: Jaipur Rural police arrested three persons who looted a truck containing copper worth Rs 1.75 crore. The metal was being transported from Bhiwadi to Gujarat.

The accused apprehended the truck in Chandwaji police station area on January 21 and abducted the driver as well as the helper who were later released in Haryana.

Police also recovered a country made pistol from the accused —Saddam Khan, 25, Sahukar Khan, 32, and Shahrukh Khan, 26. “On the day of the incident, the accused stopped the truck by parking another empty truck and a smaller vehicle in front of it. The accused then threatened him and the helper with the pistol. One accused tied up the duo and drove off with the truck while the remaining accomplices followed with their vehicles,” a police official said.

A team was constituted which started a search operation in Rajasthan, Punjab and Haryana. According to cops, the modus operandi followed by the accused was that they would first conduct a recce to find out which trucks transport valuables. Once they had confirmation, they would follow the truck in their vehicles and on an isolated stretch on the highway force the targeted vehicle to stop. After this, they would execute the crime. They would let go of the drivers and helper only after the looted goods reached a pre-decided destination. All the accused have multiple cases registered against them.

Title: Rape case witness ‘drowns’ in 1.5 feet deep canal in Bareilly district
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Representative Image

BAREILLY: A 42-year-old farmer, who was supposed to appear in court on Friday to record his statement as a witness in rape case of his niece, was found dead in a 1.5 feet deep irrigation canal at Tigra village in Bareilly district’s Hafizganj area on Thursday morning. According to autopsy report, the man is said to have “drowned”.

The farmer’s family has now alleged that he was killed by the accused named in the rape case, which occurred in 2018, as they were scared that his statement would prove them guilty. No arrests have been made so far.

Narrating the incident, the farmer’s son said that his father had gone to the fields to sprinkle water to the crops on Thursday evening. People started looking for him the next morning when he didn’t return home at night. The farmer’s body was then found in the shallow canal adjacent to his crop field. There were no injury marks on the body.

Police could not detect footmarks of any suspect as there were already many people at the spot before their arrival. The family suspected that the farmer was murdered and so they levelled allegations against two suspects. Based on their allegations, the police took the body and sent it for autopsy. The autopsy report stated the cause of death was “due to drowning”.

The farmer’s elder son also said, “There was only 1.5 feet of water. How can someone drown in it? My father has definitely been murdered. He was a witness in a rape case of my cousin and was supposed to appear in court on Friday. We have asked the police to file an FIR against two persons who are also accused in the rape case. They, however, advised us to wait for the autopsy report.”

SHO Hafizganj Mahendra Singh Yadav said, “Prima facie, the farmer was in an inebriated state and could have accidentally slipped into the canal. The autopsy report says that he died due to drowning. We are not aware that he was a witness in a rape case and we are yet to receive any written complaint from the aggrieved family.”

Title: Eastman opens centre in city
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Hyderabad: Global advanced materials and specialty additives company Eastman announced the opening of its new global operations centre spread over 93,000-sq ft near HiTec City on Thursday.

Eastman, which launched its Hyderabad operations in 2014, today has over 300 employees in Hyderabad supporting global teams in areas like finance, supply chain, procurement, engineering, and information technology.

While the company did not disclose the number of people it can accommodate at the new centre, sources said it could be around 900 at full capacity.

“Having our Global Operations Center in Hyderabad’s Silicon Valley is beneficial to our digital transformation. I’m very excited about the value the center is bringing to many of our functions in the company,” said Aldo Noseda, vice president and chief information officer, Eastman.

“We have seen great success with our Global Operations Center. The talent and capabilities we found in this community are helping support our global growth and innovation strategy. This new location gives us the flexibility to expand as the company grows,” said Srini Singamaneni, site leader for Eastman’s Hyderabad location.

With a portfolio of specialty businesses, $9.3 billion turnover Eastman works on delivering innovative products and solutions in end-markets such as transportation, building and construction, and consumables. The US-based company caters to customers in over 100 countries and has a global headcount of around 14,500.

Title: Over 90 quintals of waste removed from Naini Lake in past six months
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Worker cleaning the lake

NAINITAL: In a shocking revelation, the data provided by the Nainital district administration on Thursday revealed that more than 90 quintals of waste have been removed from Naini Lake in the past six months.

The lake which is considered to be the lifeline of Nainital is, apart from being a major tourist attraction, the source of drinking water for the entire town. The lake also sustains a very sensitive ecosystem and is home to dozens of fish species.

However, over the past few decades, the lake has become a major dumping zone. Recently, a lot of medical waste was also found near the lake.

Speaking to TOI, Nainital district magistrate (DM) Savin Bansal said, “Two boats were given to the municipality by the tourism department at a cost of around Rs 3 lakh. These boats have been used to clean the lake and our data suggests that around 90 quintals of waste was removed from the lake in the past six months.”

The two boats have been used by the Nainital civic body to clean the lake for about eight to ten hours each day and the majority of the waste removed includes plastic bottles, polythene and wood. Officials, however, said that there still needs a lot of work to be done to clean the lake. “The boats have removed a lot of waste but the lake still needs a lot of effort to be cleaned. Our workers are making every effort to clean the lake of all the wastes,” said an official of the municipal council.

Naresh Singh, a resident of Nainital said, “The lake has been polluted by human activities over several decades. Locals have been dumping solid and wet waste into the lake without even considering the effect it will have on drinking water being supplied to the entire town. It’s good that the administration is finally doing something to preserve the ecology of the lake and we hope that these steps will eventually clean the lake.”

The administration, meanwhile, said that they have made several arrangements to clean the lake and the steps will bear fruits soon. “We have installed CCTV cameras along major drains and the comprehensive cleaning of the lake is being done which has led to the improvements in the quality of water of the lake,” Bansal said.

Title: Nirma Group pays Rs 213 crore for AMC plot
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Representative image

AHMEDABAD: The much-awaited municipal plot e-auction received a subdued response on Thursday with only one developer, Nirma Group having bought a plot out of the three that were up for auction. The plot was in a posh locality just behind the Rajpath club admeasured 13,476 square metre (sqm) and was offered by AMC at a base offset price of Rs 1.59 lakh per sqm, which translates to Rs 213 cr. If sources are to be believed, Nirma Group is exploring opportunities in real estate business. It has already supported one commercial real estate project in posh Ambli area of the city.

When the auction began at 11am there were initially eight bidders. But strangely, the seven bidders remained inactive online while Nirma quoted Rs 300 per sqm extra over the base rate and bagged the deal for Rs 213.45 cr. On Wednesday, the AMC had in a press release claimed that some 56 persons had shown interest in Thursday’s e-auction. A sluggish realty market is being reasoned for the lethargic response.

Another AMC plot of 13,222 sq m located off the posh Sindhu Bhavan Road where commercial plots had been sold at rates that touched anywhere between Rs 1.7 lakh per sq m to Rs 2.5 lakh per sq m last year —bidders were seen online but they chose to remain inactive even as the AMC quoted a base offset price of Rs 1.59 lakh per sqm. This plot too remained unsold. The third plot, admesuring 15,351 sq m was located in another posh locality on Sola Science City Road and was being offered at base rate of Rs 1.59 lakh per sq m. This plot too did not find takers.

A senior AMC official said that the e-auction was transparent and that no one knew the other bidding parties online. “There is absolutely no question of builder cartels operating to force the AMC to lower the base rates even further. The e-auction was taking place on a transparent platform,” said the AMC official. Sources also claimed that the rate received by the corporation is average and it could have fetched better prices if the market sentiment was bullish.

There are 35 interested developers for Friday’s auction of two plots located in Gota and Nikol areas. “These plots are relatively small and we hope we will be able to get a better price,” said an AMC official.

“The real estate sector did not receive a mention in the recently presented Union Budget. The sector has been going through a tough phase. As a result, the real estate developers have become risk averse,” said a real estate developer.

Title: Tigers seen chewing on plastic drum in Corbett Tiger Reserve
Content:
The picture was clicked by some tourists who handed it over to the CTR administration on January 30

NAINITAL: In a sight that has worried many officials, a group of tigers in the Corbett Tiger Reserve (CTR) were seen chewing on a plastic drum in the Dhikala range in the last week of January.According to officials, a tigress and her cubs can be seen in the pictures chewing on the plastic drum which they got hold of in the Ramganga river. The picture was clicked by some tourists who handed it over to the CTR administration on January 30.Corbett director Rahul, who goes by his first name only, said, “A group of tourists have given us some pictures where a tigress and her two cubs can be seen chewing on the plastic container. We have ordered an inquiry into the incident and the investigation report will be with us soon.”Corbett is a plastic-free zone and the officials are also investigating as to how the plastic container came into the reserve. “CTR is a plastic-free zone. Even tourists are not allowed to carry plastic products here. Therefore, we are also investigating how the container came into the river. One of the possibilities is that it could have been dumped into the river by residents of one of the many villages along the river,” Rahul said.Ramganga river flows from Gairsain in Chamoli district to Ramnagar in Nainital district and passes through large parts of the CTR. The river is also a source of drinking water to animals in the protected reserve.Meanwhile, officials added that the tigers have been put under monitoring to trace their behaviour. “As a precautionary measure, the tigers seen in the pictures have been put under monitoring. However, no suspected change has occurred in their behaviour as yet,” the official said.Presence of plastic drum in Ramganga river has not only shocked the CTR administration but has also raised questions on the security of the protected zone.Chandrashekhar Joshi, deputy director of CTR, said, “Though an inquiry is on, we cannot ignore the content of the drum. We need to investigate all angles of the incident from poachers plotting to negligence of workers inside the Jhirna zone.”He added that forest officials in hill districts have been alerted to ensure that solid waste is not being dumped anywhere close to rivers. “In the past couple of days, the state witnessed rain and snow and there is a possibility that the drum might have flowed down from the hills with other solid waste,” he said.State forest minister Harak Singh Rawat said, “It is a serious matter and I have directed the officials to give a detailed report on the issue. Those found guilty will certainly be penalised and punished. Any form of plastic will not be allowed in the forests of Uttarakhand as it not only affects humans but also the wildlife.”Scientists of Dehradun-based Wildlife Institute of India (WWI) have repeatedly raised concerns regarding poor solid waste management in the hills. “Instead of treating it, garbage is lifted from one point and dumped in another in the hills. This waste menace has to stop or else it will impact the entire eco-system,” said S Sathyakumar, senior WII scientist.

Title: India should reform offset policy for flexibility: Boeing
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Lucknow: A few days after US Ambassador to India Kenneth Juster called India’s defence offset policy “inefficient”, vice-president (international sales, global sales and defence) of Boeing, Dennis Swanson, on Thursday said companies were facing problems in implementation and India should reform its policy. Speaking at a conference on US-India Partnership for Defence and Aerospace during ongoing DefExpo in Lucknow, Swanson said: “Offsets are a beneficial way to strategically grow within aerospace industry. However, companies are finding it difficult to cover offsets due to the way the policy is drafted and administered.”

He said India should reform offset policy for more flexibility in some areas, allowing Tier 1 suppliers to invest in India.

Swanson, along with other US participants including Lockheed Martin’s director for Asia Dave Sutton and OCD from US Embassy Capt Dan Fillion, also acknowledged tremendous growth in relations between India and US over the past few years, saying that both countries shared a common focus. Sutton said in 2005, there were barely any common trade and defence platforms between the two countries. “Today, our relations have developed tremendously. We get tired and frustrated with both sides working through policy issues, and for that we need to step back and look at the progress that has been made in a relatively short time,” he said.

Capt Fillion said both the countries had overlapping interests like countering terrorism. Fillion said both countries were able to successfully work with each other and, out of roughly $2 billion export by India last year, almost half went to the US.

Claiming there was high potential for India and US to work together, Swanson said some challenges should be overcome to realise potential.

“While there is alignment at senior level, there needs to be stronger alignment down the bureaucratic level and at working level. The US India Business Council has also recommended that India should announce a list of products that will be eligible for more than 49% investment by foreign companies,” he said.

Title: Chandigarh: Cab drivers’ stir enters Day 8, commuters face high fares
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

OLA cab drivers protest in Mohali on Thursday.

Title: 5 injured in AC blast in Shahjahanpur
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

BAREILLY: As many as five people were injured on Thursday after an AC compressor allegedly exploded at a paper mill under Kanth police station limits in Shahjahanpur . The injured have been admitted to medical college where they are being treated. One of them has been declared critical while others are said to be stable. The incident occurred due to some leakage in the gas compressor.

According to the information, the five mechanics were repairing an air conditioner at a paper mill in Kanth area in the afternoon. Within few minutes, there was an explosion. The incident occurred while they were refilling gas of the compressor. Those who were injured include Nabeel, Moin, Haroon, Moeed and Aamir.

SO Upendra Yadav , Kanth said, “We received the information about the incident in the afternoon and we immediately rushed to the spot. The ambulance service was also informed about the incident. The victims had severe burn injuries on their head, hands and legs. Aamir’s right eye is completely burnt, and has been referred to King Geroge ’s Medical University , Lucknow. Four others have been given first-aid and there condition is now stable.”

Title: Nashik: Gang of four inter-state burglars arrested
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Representtaive image

NASHIK: City police have arrested a gang of four inter-state burglars, who targeted locked houses, and seized cash, gold and other valuables to the tune of Rs 8.46 lakh.

The suspects, identified as Riyasatali Mansuri, Mohammad Arbaj Rafiq Ahmed Shaikh , Mohammad Azar Sarfaraz Shaikh and Sikandar Khan Chhotu Khan Pathan , were presented before a local court and have been remained in police custody till February 10.

Commissioner of police Vishwas Nangare-Patil said that on the night of January 31, assistant police inspector Mahesh Kulkarni of crime branch Unit 1 and his team were patrolling the city area when they found five people moving suspiciously in Yashwant Market area of Ambad.

“As the patrolling team got closer, the suspects started running. While one of them managed to escape, the team managed to arrest four suspects. During interrogation, the suspects confessed to have come to the city for committing burglary,” the top cop said.

“The police found a country-made firearm, two live cartridges, iron tools, one screw driver, a nylon rope, and a huge knife from the suspects. They were taken to the Ambad police station and arrested on the charges of preparation for dacoity,” he added.

During investigation, the criminals confessed that they had committed thefts and burglaries in various parts of the city and stayed in a hotel in the Nashik Road area. When the concerned hotel was checked, police found gold and silver jewellery, cellphone and cash which they had stolen from a house in the Mumbai Naka area.

The suspects have confessed to have committed burglaries under the jurisdictions of Mumbai Naka, Indiranagar, Sarkarwada, Upnagar and Gangapur police stations.

“The suspects committed four burglaries in Mumbai Naka, three in Indiranagar and one each in Sarkarwada, Upnagar and Gangapur,” a police officer said.

Title: Women come out in support of Shaheen Bagh
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Nashik: Women from the old city area came out in support of the agitators protesting against the Citizenship Amendment Act in Delhi’s Shaheen Bagh on Thursday.

Organised by the Samvidhan Premi Nashikkar and the led by the various leftist organisations, people gathered outside the Idgah Maidan and staged a sit-in for the about two hours in support of all the people who have been protesting against the CAA, National Register of Citizens (NRC) and National Population Register (NPR).

“Zor zulmi ki ladhaai mein sangharsh hamara nara ho (Struggle should be our clarion call in our fight against injustice)”, “Inquilaab zindabad”, “Hame chahiye azaadi”, were the slogans raised by the people here.

Maulana Gufran came down heavily on the central government. “The CAA is anti-national and unconstitutional. The Narendra Modi-led government has failed to provide any succour to the people who have been steadfastly opposing the act,” Gufran said appealing to the people to keep the fight going till the Act is withdrawn.

Aam Admi Party’s Balasaheb Dange also criticised the Centre saying it was diverting the attention from issues like rising inflation. Corporators Samina Memon and Vatsala Khaire also backed the protesters.

Lawyers participating in the agitation said the government was creating a smokescreen of nationalism to hide its failures.

Title: Overloading in UTC buses: Passengers take to social media to vent ire
Content:
sdgfds

Dehradun: Many passengers, dissatisfied with Uttarakhand Transport Corporation (UTC) bus service, are increasingly taking to social media platforms to vent their ire and reach out to authorities to report their issues. Besides overcrowding and overcharging, many passengers have also complained of rude behaviour by bus drivers and conductors.In a recent social media post, Champawat resident Uma Indira Upadhyay alleged that a UTC bus driver allowed over 100 passengers in a 50-seater bus travelling from Banbasa to Haridwar, a distance of almost 300 km. “Last week, I was travelling from Banbasa to Haridwar in a UTC bus (UK 07 A 1986) and the conductor was letting more and more people enter the bus even though the bus was already packed to capacity. When I told him to not allow more passengers, he sarcastically said that if I pay him Rs 20,000, he would make the trip with no passengers at all,” she said. Upadhyay also shared several pictures of the overcrowded bus along with her post.Another passenger Sanjeev Nigam complained that while he was travelling from Pauri to Dehradun, a bus driver stopped five times for refreshments during the six-hour journey. “The dhabas we stopped at were selling stale food and charging Rs 5 to Rs 10 extra than the printed price for packaged items. When I pointed this out to the bus staff, the driver rudely told me to not eat anything if I didn’t like the food and the price.”Harish Kumar, who took a UTC bus from Haridwar to Delhi, also made a similar complaint in his social media post.“The transport corporation should act on these complaints immediately as UTC buses are the primary means of transport in many areas of the hills,” said another passenger Vimal Karanwal, who travels from Tathyur to Dehradun for work almost thrice a week. When TOI contacted a UTC bus driver who drives on the Dehradun-Uttarkashi route, regarding the charges levelled by passengers, he said, “In hills, passengers are simply waiting to get inside the bus, irrespective of whether it is loaded or not, because of less availability of buses. They criticise us when we don’t stop the bus and they criticise us even when we do."Meanwhile, reacting to the complaints, Ranvir Singh Chauhan, managing director of UTC, told TOI that passengers should approach the right forums to make complaints if they need solutions. “It is very easy to find the numbers of officials now-a-days. Passengers can call me or send a message/video to me in such cases. If someone just writes his/her experience on social media, how will the department come to know about the issue and act on it?" he queried.The official added that UTC is soon planning to launch a toll-free helpline number which will be mentioned on all the buses. "The passengers would be able to register their complaints on the helpline. Meanwhile, our other helpline number 8476007605 is also active," Chauhan said.

Title: Uttar Pradesh: Boy attacks teacher with kitchen knife
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Representative image

LUCKNOW: A Class VIII student of a CBSE school in Kakori attacked his teacher with a kitchen knife on Thursday, apparently angry over being made to sit in the front row so that he paid more attention to studies.

Class teacher Shyam Gupta managed to escape with gashes on the neck and in the stomach, and is said to be out of danger. The 14-year-old boy is on the run.

Assistant commissioner of police, Kakori, Qasim Abidi told TOI that the student was often scolded by the teacher for his poor academic performance and might have been nursing a grudge for long.

The teenager was evidently infuriated when Gupta decided to keep an eye on him and made him move to the front bench.

“The boy allegedly took out a kitchen knife, which he had brought from home, and attacked his teacher. The latter was injured in the attack after which the boy fled. He has remained untraceable till now (Thursday evening),” Abidi said.

Sources in the school said the teacher was first taken to the Kakori community health centre and later referred to KGMU Trauma Centre, where doctors indicated that the injuries were not life-threatening.

Police said the father of the boy was a tailor by profession, but his maternal and paternal uncles were in jail for murders.

Title: Property tax: MC’s notices to PPCC set aside
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Chandigarh: The Punjab and Haryana high court has set aside the Chandigarh municipal corporation’s show-cause notices to the Punjab Pradesh Congress Committee (PPCC), wherein a penalty of Rs 8.4 lakh was imposed on it on arrears of property tax from 2004 to 2010.

The court has also directed the MC to pass an appropriate order in accordance with law. The court order reads, “The present petition stands disposed of and impugned show-cause notices are set aside to enable the respondent to pass an appropriate order in accordance with law. Till the reasoned order is passed, no coercive steps shall be taken against the petitioner.”

PPCC had moved the high court in 2018, seeking setting aside of the MC notices of December 20, 2017, and February 21, 2018, wherein a penalty of Rs 8,36,861 was imposed on it. These pertained to the assessment years 2004-05, 2005-06, 2006-07, 2007-08, 2008-09 and 2009-10, for which no demand notice was received by the petitioner, the PPCC added.

The petitioner’s counsel, Kanwalvir Singh Kang, submitted in the court that the notices were issued after a lapse of over 10 years and before that no demand notice/recovery notice towards the payment of property tax was ever received by the petitioner.

“The petitioner has been paying property tax for the assessment years of which the bill was duly received by the petitioner. Even otherwise when it had come to the notice of the petitioner that there were unpaid arrears of principal amount of property tax, the petitioner had paid Rs 6,48,265. But the MC, despite its own lapse for being unable to raise any demand notice for the last 10 years, suddenly undertook a harsh measure for recovery of penalty of Rs 8,36,681, which is more than the principal amount,” the counsel added.

Title: Army steps up coronavirus vigil along China, Nepal entry points
Content:
Lt Gen Anup Banerji (fourth from left) inspects a stall at the Armed Forces Medical College on Thursday

PUNE: The Indian armed forces have strengthened vigil at all the entry points along the China and Nepal borders in view of the coronavirus outbreak, director general Armed Forces Medical Service (DG-AFMS) Lieutenant General Anup Banerji said on Thursday.“There is tight vigil on the border posts so that nobody can cross by road without a medical check,” Banerji told reporters on the second day of the 58th conference of the armed forces medical research committee at the Armed Forces Medical College (AFMC).“The army has set up a quarantine facility at Manesar in Haryana and has examined 250 people evacuated from China last month. They are safe. The AFMS has responded to the call to check coronavirus,” he added.If required, more quarantine facilities will be set up in other parts of the country. The government has recently sanctioned 10 laboratories for carrying out research on viruses, he said.The Nepal government confirmed two cases of coronavirus in January. A sizeable population from Nepal comes to India via border posts every day and thorough medical examinations are needed. Currently, the army and para military forces manning the border posts, are wearing surgical mask as precautionary measure, a senior army officer, who did not wish to be named, told TOI.A senior AFMS official, who did not wish to be named, told TOI, “Currently, the coronavirus samples are being tested only at National Institute of Virology in Pune and All India Institute of Medical Science in New Delhi. The AFMS laboratories and the newly sanctioned facilities, one of which would be in AFMC, can also be utilised for testing the samples.”On suicides in the armed forces, Banerji said they were concerned and doctors and psychiatrists are identifying such tendencies early and treating them.The armed forces hospitals will be equipped to provide quality healthcare across the country. The AFMS has entered a Memorandum of Understanding with institutions like AIIMS to share knowledge, training and exchanging faculties, he said.“The army has deployed enough troops along the areas bordering China and Nepal. Providing medical care in these areas in a priority for the AFMS. There is a high possibility of setting up more quarantine facilities,” the officer added.

Title: Suspend census process, opposition tells state government
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

THIRUVANANTHAPURAM: The Congress-led opposition in the assembly demanded from the state government to suspend census enumeration process until National Population Register (NPR) fears are allayed. While moving a notice seeking leave for adjournment in the assembly, the opposition alleged that NPR and census have the same questionnaire and hence the state government cannot change questions as promised.

However, chief minister Pinarayi Vijayan said that the state government cannot obstruct the census enumeration process. “The census process will go on. But the state government has ensured that none of the questionnaire in the NPR is incorporated in the census. Directives have been given to all district collectors that no enumerators should carry out activities meant for NPR,” said Vijayan.

Opposition leader Ramesh Chennithala alleged that the state government has no role in the questionnaire and it has been prepared by the census directorate. “The census directorate has started sending letters to the civic body secretaries urging them to appoint enumerators for census. NPR and census directorate are the same now and hence the Centre will issue the questionnaire inclusive of the NPR. The state government cannot do anything on this. Hence, the census operations in the state should be suspended,” he said.

IUML’s M K Muneer said that the state government has not taken the issue seriously. All enumerators, once appointed, will be directly under the census directorate and they can only obey orders of the census registrar. “The chief minister should discuss with officials and review the decisions. All letters by the registrar of census includes mention of the NPR too. Hence, the state government can suspend the census process for not collecting data for the NPR,” said Muneer.

Earlier K M Shaji of the IUML, who issued the notice for the adjournment motion in the House on this, said that in the guise of census enumeration the Centre wants to collect details for NPR too. He said that the state government should protest against this and stop all procedures for census.

Parliamentary affairs minister A K Balan had come with a point of order against Shaji, claiming that he cannot seek the leave for an adjournment motion since he is facing an election case in the Supreme Court. But the speaker overruled this and said he can stay away from voting. “He can attend all the proceedings of the House,” said the speaker. Later, the opposition staged a walkout from the House since the speaker denied permission for a discussion on the notice by suspending the proceedings.

Title: Health scare casts shadow on travel plans to Southeast Asian countries
Content:
Representative image

PUNE: The coronavirus outbreak has affected travel not only to China but also to other southeast Asian countries like Singapore, Thailand, Vietnam and Malaysia this month and the upcoming summer vacation.Travel companies told TOI that the decline in bookings to some Southeast Asian countries other than China has been to the tune of 30-60% for February and March. “We have even seen cancellations of old bookings for countries like Thailand and Singapore recently. No new bookings are coming right now for several southeast Asian countries,” Jyoti Mayal, president, Travel Agents Association of India (TAAI), said.A source from the Indian travel and hotel booking e-commerce website ixigo said, “We have seen a 50% year-on-year decline in bookings for February this year as compared to the previous year for countries like Japan, Malaysia and Singapore. But Thailand and Vietnam bookings have not been impacted.”Santosh Gupta, owner, Shree Vinayak Holidays,said that travel to other countries in southeast Asia has already been affected. Hemant Jani, owner, Raunak Tours, said, “Around 50%-60% of my clients who had booked their travel to Singapore, Malaysia and Thailand postponed their trips.”Vijay Thakkar, director, Hasmukh Travels, said, “Our bookings were full for travel to countries like Vietnam, Cambodia and Thailand in February but many are now thinking whether they should continue with their plans. ”Balu Ramachandran, Sr VP, Cleartrip, said, “We are seeing a 20-60% drop in bookings to some of the countries in southeast Asia from India.” Rakshit Desai, MD, FCM Travel Solutions, said, “Customers are taking caution and checking with us before travelling to Thailand, Japan etc." However, Rajeev Kale, country head, holiday, MICE, visa, Thomas Cook (India) Ltd, said, “We see no adverse impact on other destinations in SE Asia like Singapore, Indonesia, Malaysia or Thailand.”

Title: Doctors cautioned over fake certificates
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Photo for representative purpose only

KOCHI: Doctors in the city have been advised against giving fake certificates regardless of their personal obligation to the person demanding it.

As per the guidelines for issuing medical certificates by doctors, IMA- Kochi , has said, “Doctors frequently issue medical certificates as part of their routine work. However, an improperly issued certificate can land them in serious trouble.”

The guidelines were issued after the matter was discussed by IMA-Kochi’s executive committee on January 15, as part of its medical ethics initiative.

Signed by Dr Rajeev Jayadevan , president, IMA-Kochi, it asks doctors to refrain from issuing medical certificate without examining the patient. “The doctor can ask for a request form to be filled stating who is requesting the certificate and for what reason, with the place, date and the requesting person’s signature,” it states.

Doctors have been asked to refer to it while issuing the certificates for ‘discourage illegal requests’.

The letter mentions several ‘illegal’ requests doctors get, including certificates issued to students to take medical leave of absence, those issued to avoid court duty, for driver’s licence, or to obtain undeserving leave from place of work.

They have also been advised to include patient’s signature in the medical certificate.

“A policy about issuing certificates may be displayed in the clinic to discourage those who make illegal requests,” it states.

Title: Ahmedabad: 4 rounds fired at jewellery shop in thwarted robbery
Content:
Three men who arrived on a motorcycle, fired four rounds in a jeweller’s shop in New Gandhinagar on Thursday ... Read More

AHMEDABAD: Three men who arrived on a motorcycle, fired four rounds in a jeweller’s shop in New Gandhinagar on Thursday night. According to police sources, the robbers arrived at New Adhishawar Jewellers in Kudasan village at 8.30pm. The owner of the shop, Kamlesh Jain, was shot in his shoulder and has been taken to hospital.had a helmet on, tried to rob the shop, but were thwarted by Jain and his employee.A senior police official said the robbers fired four rounds, one of which hit Jain. The robbers then fled as people began to gather at the spot. Senior police officials have reached the spot and ordered roadblocks at all entry and exit points of Gandhinagar. Gandhinagar SP Mayur Chavda said they have got CCTV footage of the robbers and will nab them soon.In Video: On cam: Armed robbers shoot jewellery store owner after scuffle

Title: Jaipur cops arrest three who fired at man
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Representative image

JAIPUR: City police arrested three persons who had fired at a man in Mansarovar area of Jaipur on February 2, in what appears to be a case of gang rivalry.

The complainant Ravi Badgurjar had registered a case against the three accused at Shipra Path police station alleging that he was fired at by them and had to run to save his life. The accused were identified as Karan Singh, Mehtab Singh and Jafar. Police also recovered two country-made weapons from them.

“The complainant and the accused were initially part of the same gang which was led by Bharatpur-based Vijay Pal. They indulged in illegal sand mining and liquor smuggling. After a while, Karan broke away and formed his own gang. Angered with this, Vijay got Karan brutally thrashed. Some time back, Vijay was killed in a gang war in Bharatpur,” said a police official.

According to police, Karan came back to Mansarovar area and started an operation to eliminate rest of the members of Vijay’s gang, which included the complainant.

A team was constituted to trace the accused and prevent a possible gang war. Police placed barricades and using human intelligence, found the accused’s location following which they were arrested. They have been booked under relevant IPC sections and the Arms Act.

Title: Koodathayi murders: SIT files fifth chargesheet
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

KOZHIKODE: The special investigation team probing Koodathayi multiple murders, on Thursday, filed chargesheet in the fifth murder case.

The 1,069-page chargesheet, with 175 witnesses and 173 documents, was filed before Thamarassery magistrate court after completing probe into the death of Tom Thomas Ponnamattom, father of Jolly Joseph ’s first husband, Roy Thomas. According to the chargesheet, Jolly murdered Tom by giving him a cyanide-filled capsule.

Addressing reporters, K G Simon , district police chief ( Kozhikode rural), who also heads the SIT, said first accused Jolly committed the crime for acquiring Tom’s property. “Jolly used cyanide for the first time to murder Tom. Second accused in the case M S Mathew, a jewellery employee, had provided cyanide to Jolly. Third accused Prajikumar, a goldsmith, had sold the cyanide to Mathew.”

“Jolly filled cyanide in Tom’s mushroom capsule and gave it to him before the evening prayer. He collapsed during the prayer and could not be saved even though he was taken to a hospital nearby,” Simon said.

“A few days after Tom’s death, Jolly had asked others in the family to examine Tom’s documents. She recovered a fake property will from his room. The signature on the will was marked with the help of a photocopier. Jolly had added her name using a typewriter, Simon said adding that a copy of the signature and the typewriter were produced before the court.

Jolly’s elder son, Tom’s daughter, neighbours, bank employees and others are witnesses in the case.

Simon said SIT would soon submit chargesheet in the sixth murder too.

Title: Karvy group’s CMD steps down from Pennar Ind board
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Hyderabad: Nearly one and a half months after he stepped down from the board of Granules India Ltd, beleaguered Karvy Group chairman and managing director C Parthasarathy has resigned from the board of another Hyderabad-based company Pennar Industries Ltd as independent director.

Pennar Industries informed the bourses that it has received Parthasarathy’s resignation letter and its board will take the same on at the ensuing board meeting on February 11, 2020.

In his resignation letter, a copy of which was submitted by Pennar Industries to the stock exchanges, Parthasarathy has cited his “preoccupations” as the reason for tendering his resignation from the company’s board of directors.

It was in December end that the CMD of the scam-hit Karvy Group had stepped down from the Granules India board. He also had to resign from the board of erstwhile Karvy Fintech Pvt Ltd (now known as KFin Technologies Pvt Ltd) in November end this year due to pressure from mutual funds after stock market regulator Sebi banned Karvy Stock Broking Ltd from taking on new clients following the broking firm’s failure to comply with Sebi norms on pledging client securities for borrowings. KSBL had pledged the securities of around 95,000 clients to raise over Rs 2300 crore from various banks and financial institutions.

KFin Technologies, which serves as registrar and transfer agent to several fund houses, is majority owned by General Atlantic and underwent a rechristening to disassociate itself from the scam-hit Karvy brand.

Title: School bullies behind suicidal teens in Chandigarh: Expert
Content:
Representative image

‘Schools can help detect troubled child’

CHANDIGARH: Besides unfulfilled ambitions and failed relationships , school bullies are also a major source of anxiety, frustration, and depression in suicidal teenagers. Adolescent health experts keep receiving these cases.Counsellor Chhaya Prasad, who runs a parental skills guidance clinic, has found children with problem of speech articulation, mispronunciation, and learning disability to be soft targets of bullies in their class. She advises parents to have regular communication with their teenaged children to bring them out of this dejection. Her clinic has adopted six government schools for child awareness.She said: “Symptoms of bullying are in child’s falling attendance, quietness, isolation, bursts of anger, and deteriorating handwriting. If parents interact with their children, they can spot these common signs easily and confront this problem at the initial stage. Spend quality time with children every day to build up their confidence. Talk to them about their friends, teachers, bus driver, and other people they meet. Scan their notebooks daily and consult development pediatricians, if need be.”Between 2015 and 2019, 81 teenagers committed suicide in the city. The grim figures have prompted experts to ask parents, teachers, siblings and friends to look out for warning signs such as poor eating habits, depression, short temper, and mood swings. Psychiatrists at Government Medical College and Hospital, Sector 32, list six reasons why children kill self—academic pressure, frequent break-ups in relationships, poor tolerance and aggression, lack of parental attention, alcohol abuse, and easy access to means of suicide such as firearms.Hanging is the most common mode of suicide, followed by consuming poisonous substances and jumping into lake or off the buildings.Experts say that schools can play a major role in detecting whether a child is troubled or not. On its part, the UT administration has appointed counsellors in government schools to help students cope up with examination stress and observe the signs of suicidal tendencies. They give regular special lectures on stress management to the students of classes V to XII and monitor each of them. During parent-teacher meetings, they tell parents about keeping their wards relaxed.A few years ago, online game Blue Whale was blamed for many suicides among children in the country. In this challenge, a designated curator assigns players tasks over a 50-day period, culminating in the player's committing suicide, for real. However, no confirmed case of a player's committing suicide was reported official in the Tricity.

Title: Alert ex-soldier helps police nab impostor in Ahmednagar
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Representative image

PUNE: Thanks to an eagle-eyed retired soldier, the Kotwali police have arrested a 45-year-old man, who allegedly posed as a lieutenant colonel in Ahmednagar.

The incident occurred at the Ahmednagar bus station on Wednesday. The retired soldier noticed the impostor’s fake Army uniform, medals and ribbons.

The former soldier, Rajram Gavali, who served in the Mechanised Infantry Regiment of the Indian Army for 24 years, currently works in the control room of the bus stand.

On Wednesday afternoon, the veteran spotted the suspect wearing the Army uniform waiting at the stand. “Since he was in uniform, I approached to help him,” Gavali told TOI over the phone.

During the conversation, Gavali enquired about the man’s service, posting and units. “He told me that he was posted in the parachute unit, but his uniform did not match. This prompted me to examine the service ribbons on the uniform, which were not in proper order. These two factors convinced me that he was not an Army officer,” Gavali said.

He immediately called up the adjutant of the Mechanised Infantry Regimental Centre in Ahmednagar. “While I was on the phone, the man got suspicious. He immediately removed his shirt, put it in his bag and left the bus stand. A duty officer and I chased him for some distance and nabbed him. When we asked him for his identity card, he started abusing us. We took him to a nearby police chowkey, where he revealed his real name,” Gavali further said.

Meanwhile, Army personnel from MIRC and Army intelligence staff soon arrived the chowky and questioned him. “Under questioning, he conceded that he was not an army officer,” Gavali said

“We have recovered one fake stamp of the Maratha Light Infantry, a fake Army uniform, six debit cards, mobile phones with six SIM cards, over Rs10,000 in cash, and duplicate air pistol with 40 rounds from his possession,” a police officer said.

The man has been identified as Sanjay Vithoba Patil, a resident of Haathkhamba village in Ratnagiri.

The police have arrested him under sections 171 (wearing garb or carrying token used by public servant with fraudulent intent), 420 (cheating), 467 (forgery of valuable security, will, etc) and 471 (Using as genuine a forged document) of the Indian Penal Code .

Police said they are in the process of ascertaining the man’s motive. “At the moment, we suspect that the man has duped people by making false promises of helping them get jobs in the Indian army. Our investigation is on,” added the officer.

Last October, the Chandannagar police in Pune booked a cyber-crook, who posed as an Army jawan and duped a man from Wadgaonsheri of Rs84,600 on the pretext of selling him a motorcycle online.

Title: Solar power for schools in rural Maharashtra
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Representative image

PUNE: Solar panels will be installed at government schools in rural areas of Maharashtra to combat frequent power shutdown and improve digital education.

With increasing digitization of schools — e-learning schemes, digital attendance and more — schools need to be self-reliant in terms of electricity to address the need of the hour. To this enbd, the state government will soon install solar panels in every school that would generate 1-1.5KV electricity.

A meeting of state education officials — including commissioner of education Vishal Solanki and school education minister Varsha Gaikwad — was recently held by deputy chief minister Ajit Pawar in Mumbai.

Officials who attended the meeting said the solar panel project would be initiated with the help of Maharashtra Energy Development Agency (MEDA).

Solanki said, “Many proposals were discussed during this meeting. However, decisions on the proposals are still pending. The electricity bills of several government schools in Maharashtra have been pending with the electricity board. Thus many schools do not get power due to a cut-off while some others face shut downs.”

Power supply is a major issue for the schools as the government has introduced various schemes over the past three years, some of which require access to the Internet. Linking of students’ Aadhaar cards with bank accounts, attendance update on a daily basis, e-learning kits screened on digital boards, among others, are a few such examples.

Over 70% of the 90,000 schools across the state have been digitized in five years. But students in several schools have not benefited. Teachers blame outages and poor internet facilities. There has been a demand from schools to the government to provide solar panels to address power shutdown issues for five years. In some schools, fresh packs of LED screens and projectors are left unutilized.

Title: Case filed against money changer
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Ahmedabad: A Vastrapur resident, Anant Patel, 60, filed a complaint against a money changer, Vipul Patel of Ranip at Vastrapur police station on Thursday morning. Anant alleged that Vipul, who hails from the same village as the complainant, cheated him of US $600. According to the FIR, Anant had given Vipul US $600 to change into Indian currency at his firm Shree Umiya Forex Pvt Ltd, located at Shreeji Tower. However, the cheque that Vipul had given him had been dishonoured due to insufficient funds, and despite repeated attempts, Anant was unable to get his money from Vipul. Finally, he lodged a complaint under sections 406 and 420 of the IPC. Anant also stated that Vipul had shut down his office.

Inspector Manoharsinh Jadeja of Vastrapur police station said they are looking for the accused.

The FIR states that Anant and his wife had gone to visit their son in Georgia, USA, in February 2019 and had returned in July 2019. When they returned to India, they had US $600 with them, which was part of the money their son had given them for expenses.

According to the FIR, when Anant had given Vipul the money the value of an US dollar was Rs 71.80, and the entire amount to be received was approximately Rs 43,000. Anant received the cheque from Vipul on January 1, 2020, but ultimately deposited it on January 17 upon Vipul’s request. But the cheque bounced.

Title: Functionary of NCP for quick arrests and trial
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

PIMPRI CHINCHWAD: President of NCP’s state women unit Roopali Chakankar on Thursday demanded the Maharashtra home minister to fast track cases of crimes against women and also ensure arrest of the suspects in such offences.

Her demand followed the gruesome attacks on women in Nagpur and Panvel. “In the previous state government, chief minister Devendra Fadnavis was also holding the portfolio of the state home minister. However, he proved to be an unsuccessful home minister. Dakshata committees were closed during his tenure,” Chakankar said.

In the absence of the committees and beat marshals, security of women took a hit in the past five years, she alleged.

When asked if there was a need for conducting encounter of accused like in the Telangana case, she said, “As a woman, I feel punishment should be awarded according to the crime. People want accused in such crimes to be hanged and we demand that too.”

Title: Display profession on your vehicle, face challan
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Chandigarh: Thirteen days after the Punjab and Haryana high court banned the display of designations or description of offices on both private and government vehicles, the Chandigarh administration on Thursday finally issued orders in this regard.

The order reads, “No government or private vehicle will carry words like court, army, airport, navy, police, press, etc.” The order also said no vehicle was allowed to display designations like chairman and vice-chairman, among others.

However, the UT added, “Words like government/ UT administration can be allowed when the occupants are performing government duties.” It clarified that district magistrates, additional district magistrates, doctors, ambulances and fire brigades can display designations or offices only during performance of magisterial or medical duty in emergency situations.

On January 24, the Punjab and Haryana high court had banned display of designations and professions on private as well as government vehicles in city, and asked the police to enforce the directions within 72 hours. Under the order, display of designation/description of office and unauthorised emblems was prohibited. Printing words like ‘court’, ‘army’, ‘press’ and ‘police’ and designations, such as chairman and vice-chairman, was also banned. Only ambulances, fire brigades, police cars and other vehicles used for rescue operations were exempted. Earlier, there was confusion among traffic cops over challaning vehicles with such stickers.

No relief for Kher

The order has not given any relief to city MP Kirron Kher. Claiming special status on account of being an MP, Kher had earlier demanded that she be allowed to use a flag with ‘MP’ written on it on her car. In a letter to the UT adviser on January 27, she had referred to the HC order and said: “Being a Member of Parliament, I have to visit various places across Tricity for official and non-official works. The recognition of my vehicle must be in the knowledge of officials and the general public. Therefore, I must be allowed to fly a flag on my vehicle mentioning ‘MP’.”

Vehicles from other states

Sources said the UT administration was likely to seek guidelines from the Punjab and Haryana high court on Friday on implementation of the order for vehicles coming from other states.

Title: Debt-ridden jeweller shoots self after killing wife, 4-month-old son
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

The deceased man, who was suffering from severe depression, has been identified as 30-year-old Pradeep Rastogi

RAMPUR: A debt-ridden jeweller allegedly shot dead his wife and four-month-old son and later killed himself at Subhash Nagar Colony under Bilaspur Kotwali police station on Thursday.

The deceased man, who was suffering from severe depression, has been identified as 30-year-old Pradeep Rastogi .

Bilaspur circle officer Brahmpal Singh told TOI on Thursday, “Pradeep Rastogi was suffering from depression after he came under a huge debt. During preliminary investigation, it was found that he took loan from banks and was unable to repay them.”

The circle officer added, “He had spoken to his brothers on their mobile phone about his plan to commit suicide . When the brothers reached his house they found that Pradeep, his wife and son were lying in a pool of blood. And a pistol was also lying near the man's body.”

On the brother’s complaint, the police and experts at forensic science laboratory reached the spot. It was found that the deceased man was running a jewellery shop at Rudrapur in Uttarakhand and was suffering from depression.

The police have sent the bodies to Rampur district hospital for postmortem.

Title: Kids shine at state level maths wizard, spelling competition
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Dehradun: The Uttarakhand education department under the aegis of Samagra Shiksha project organised a ‘State Level Maths Wizard and Spelling Genius Competition 2020’ on Thursday in Dehradun.

The competition was thrown open for Class 5 students studying in the state’s government schools. The students were shortlisted after qualifying through various levels of competition namely school-level, block-level, district-level and then finally, state-level.

The winners of the Maths Wizard completion were Tejasv Aithani from Bageshwar (1st position), Aditya Singh from Tehri Garhwal (2nd position) and Neeraj Baghri from Bageshwar (3rd position).

The winners of the Spelling Genius completion were Hridyansh Dangwal from Bageshwar (1stposition), Riya from Pauri Garhwal (2nd position) and Mithali Pant from Nainital (3rd position).

Title: Rajasthan Temperature: Mercury dips across Rajasthan, Fatehpur coldest at -0.2 degree C
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Men warm themselves by a fire on a cold winter day in the city

JAIPUR: Mercury continued to take a downward swing across the state on Thursday when majority of the places witnessed a dip in mercury. Fatehpur remained coldest in the state where a minimum temperature of minus 0.2°C.

Attributing the dip in the mercury to the active northerly winds and vanishing of factors like upper air cyclonic circulation and western disturbances, Jaipur Met office said that mercury will further take a dip across the state in the next couple of days.

People in Jaipur experienced a chilly morning when a minimum temperature of 10.6°C was recorded. It was followed by a comparatively warmer afternoon as a maximum temperature of 22.9°C, almost 2 degree below the normal was recorded. Mild fog and mist also affected the road, rail and air traffic from Jaipur. The traffic on the highways connecting Jaipur to Agra, Jaipur to Delhi and Jaipur to Churu was chaotic due to poor visibility in the morning. A few early morning flights got delayed due to the hazy morning while at least six trains arrived late at the Jaipur railway station due to fog and mist in neighbouring states including Delhi, Punjab and Haryana.

Fatehpur was followed by Sikar where a minimum temperature of 3°C was recorded. People in Sikar also witnessed foggy morning which affected normal life and vehicular traffic.

Fatehpur and Sikar were followed by Churu where a minimum temperature of 3.7°C was recorded, Sriganganagar 6.3°C, Jaisalmer 7.8°C, Jodhpur 9.4°C, Kota and Ajmer 9.8°C each, Udaipur and at Barmer and Udaipur a minimum temperature of 10°C was recorded.

In its forecast Jaipur met office said that in the next couple of days. “Till February 10 the mercury will continue to take a dip across the state especially during early morning hours. Weather would be mainly dry especially during afternoon when bright sunny days are ahead,” said an officer while quoting the forecast for Rajasthan .

Title: Madhya Pradesh: BJP leader among four held for lynching; five cops suspended
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

Minister Jitu Patwari visits a survivor in hospital on Thursday

MHOW/INDORE/BHOPAL: Four suspects — including a local BJP leader — have been arrested for the Manawar lynching , which has triggered a political storm in Madhya Pradesh . Five policemen, among them the Manawar police station in-charge, were suspended for negligence, Dhar SP Aditya Pratap Singh told TOI on Thursday.

The BJP leader, Ramesh Junapani, is sarpanch of Junapani village and is alleged to be the ‘kingpin’ of the attack. Police say he instigated the mob to attack the six farmers from Ujjain, who had gone to Borlai village in Dhar on Wednesday, looking for some labourers, who had taken advance of Rs 50,000 each to work in their farms, but did not show up.
